item.title: Destiny, Purpose... What is it? What is my gift???
item.dc:creator: Danika
item.content:encoded: Destiny is the inevitable or necessary fate to which a particular person 0r thing is destined. Purpose is the reason for which something's is done or created or for which something exists. A Gift is a notable capacity, talent, or endowment; something voluntarily transferred by one person to another without compensation. You see, everyone was created with a purposed gift to bring about their destiny. Destiny is inevitable. It is a necessary fate. In other words, destiny is something you cannot escape. Whatever God has for you is for you. You can't change that, give it back, nor negotiate that. And better yet, can't no man take that from you. If you are a child of God, you were preDESTINED, you were called, you were justified, and you were glorified. (Romans 8: 29-30). So don't be afraid or run from your destiny. It's yours for the taking. You were called for that, you were justified for that, and God has glorified you to do that. So do it! Purpose is the reason something was done or created. God creating you was not a mistake, no matter what your mom or dad has said. You were DESTINED to be created. Embrace it. You were PURPOSELY created. Everything and everyone has a purpose. So really and truly, there are no mistakes. But in all honesty, God loves "mistakes" It doesn't say that He heals the non-broken, He heals the broken, He heals the sick! Jesus tell us in Matthews 11:28-29 (KJV) Come unto me all ye that labour and are heave laden, and I will give you rest. Take my yoke upon you, and learn of me; for I am meek and lowly in heart: and ye shall find rest unto your souls. He don't ask for people that "got it all together" to come to Him. He don't need you. You got it, so what is it that He can do for you?? That's why I believe God chooses the "mistaken", the broken hearted, the ones with a past, the ones who were told they will never amount to anything, those that were tore down by the ones that should have been lifting them up, those that was told they are going to end up either dead or in jail. THOSE are the ones that shine brighter than those always seen. If all dogs can bark, then no one will be surprised at the next dog that barks, but now if dog meows, then that dog is more likely to turn more heads than the "normal" dog. Can we all say that often times its best to be different!? Why be the same??? Especially if everybody are doing the same things!? A gift is a notable capacity, talent, OR endowment. So don't think just because you can't sing, dance, write, or what have you that God made you giftless. The conjunction "or"  is used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives or used in correlation. Meaning, in order to be considered having a gift does not requires you having all three. If that was the case, there would have been "and" where the "or" was placed. You don't necessarily have to have a "talent" to bless God and others with your gift. For instance, notable capacity. Your gift could be the ability or power to do, experience, or understand something worthy of attention or notice; to recognize something in somebody to focus on to help bring out the good and better in them or to realize that someone is hurting on the inside even when they are smiling on the outside. Being that person to lend a listening ear to those with a battered and broken heart that needs to speak. Or, on the other hand, you may not be a really good listener, nor do you have talent, but The Lord has blessed you with financial blessings. That's where endowment comes into place. Your gift can be simply purchasing books for the not so privilege child who is determined to bettering him/herself but the world or "system" seems to be against them and even though they are trying and doing the right things, they still fall short, or if you can't cook, it can be purchasing can goods and/or non perishable items to give to the needy and homeless. A gift is so wide range and I think that's where a lot of us gets confused, scared, or nervous about. Your gift may not be as "flashy", "extravagant", or whatevs as the next, but your gift is your gift! Not to compare to others, but to share with others. 1 Corinthians 12:4 (KJV) says: Now there are diversities of gifts, but the same Spirit. 1  Corinthians 7:7 (NET) says: I wish that everyone was as I am. But each has his own gift from God, one this way, another that. And then Roman 6:12 (KJV) says: Having then gifts differing according to the grace that is given to us, whether prophecy, let us prophesy according to the proportion of faith. From all three of these verses, we can see that everyone has their own gift and Romans tells us to act accordingly to those gifts to the proportion of our faith. Meaning, your gifts will and shall reflect your faith. If you don't have faith that if you sow bountifully then you shall reap bountifully, then 9xs out of 10, your gift wont be of monetary things. But 1Peter 4:10-11 tells us to use our gifts to serve one another as good stewards of the varied grace of God. V11 (NET): Whosever speaks, let it be with God's word. Whoever serves, do so with the strength that God supplies so that in everything God will be glorified through Jesus Christ... So at the end of it all, your gift is not to reap manly blessing, or to glorify man and/or uplift yourself, but they are to serve one another and to glorify The Father. It's not about you, but its about Jesus. Romans 12:3 (KJV) tells us: For I say through the grace given unto me, to every man that is among you, not to think of himself more highly the he ought to think; but to think soberly, according as God hath dealt to every man the measure of faith. In other words, yes, think highly of yourself, be confident in your gifts and your works, but don't pat yourself too hard on the back for God has only given you what's equivalent to your faith. So I ask you, what is your faith level?! Now, I know I spent a lot of time going in on gifts because I feel that's the thing that's hindering some us from realizing our purpose and going into our destiny. You see, I been knew I had the gift of words since a child, but I never was fully comfortable in it because I felt I wasn't as advanced as the next person who wrote poetry and I was as brave as the next person to share my words with others outside of my inner circle or those who I wrote pieces about or for. And then, I wasn't really saved, even though I was baptized (yes, there is a difference), nor living right at all to fully use my gift or to know that the purpose of my gift was for my destiny. But don't get me wrong, I am no where, shape, or form living completely right, and none of us ever will, but the difference now from then is when I slip up (and I do, I'm human), I go to God and admit my wrong(s), and wholeheartedly, not only ask for forgiveness, but repent (there is a difference), and move forward and not stay or dwell on that mistake. Therefore my spirit gets renewed and the conviction and guilt be removed; but that's a whole nother blog for a totally different day. I am now to the point where I am ready to accept my gift, embrace my purpose, and work towards my destiny. After being told many, many times, by multiple different people, and receiving tons of confirmations over the last couple of days this blog was created. I don't know what its going to do, where its going to go, or how it will be perceived or accepted, but what I do know that I am not doing it for me, those who told me I just need to go on ahead and start blogging, but I am doing it for Him. Also, I pray that this can reach, help, or touch somebody; whether its to confirm something they already knew, open their eyes to realize and see their gifts, purpose, and destiny, or touch them enough to decide its time to change and use their gifts for good rather than evil. As Philippians 4:17 (NET) says: I do not say this because I am seeking a gift. Rather, I seek the credit that abounds to your account. I don't want any "amen"s or pats on the back for this; what I want is to use my gift and my story to glorify God and to motivate and uplift others so that they may prosper and grow and bless others. So, with that being said.....This is my gift from God to you. -DanikaKayelle XOXO

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: By far this blog is awesome! I actually prayed today for clarification on what exactly is my gift! Wow! For me to read how a gift really can be versus what I thought it was in my mind this makes sense to me. I believe I know what my gift is now. Thanks:) Keep blogging what's on your heart.

item.title: Kiss my Awesome, Sweet Self!
item.dc:creator: Danika
item.content:encoded: This morning when I got up, I was prepared to write something else and I heard something say, "Kiss my aye.es.es.".. I was like, "whaaaat"..and it said, "Kiss my Awesome, Sweet Self".. All I could do was laugh and say, "My God is a fool", and then I thought to myself, "My God IS Awesome, He IS Sweet"; then a light in my head went off and was like, "Blog about me" and now here I am! Have you every really sat back and realized how awesome God is? How sweet He is?? Let's think about it. How awesome is it that we have NO clue how or who created God but He created all these things??!? He created the tiny little ant to the tallest tree in the forest and everything in between. He created the Heavens and the Earth. He created man and woman. Simply from speaking a word and from dust. How awesome is that?! All throughout the Old Testament it talks about how awesome God is. I love what it says in Deuteronomy 10:16-18 and 21: (NET) Therefore cleanse your heart and stop being so stubborn! For the Lord your God is God of gods and Lord of lords, the great, mighty, and AWESOME God who is unbiased and takes no bribe, who justly treats the orphan and widow, and who loves resident foreigners, giving them food and clothing. V21: He is the one you should praise; He is your God, the one who has done these great and AWESOME things for you that you have seen. Out of all the verses, this one stood out to me the most because I remember one day questioning myself and Him for that matter, like, "Man! God tells us not to boast ourselves or like, do things not for praise or glory and yet He wants us to sit here and give him ALL the praise and ALL the glory, He is something else!" [Being stubborn right?!] Now when I tell you, the Holy Spirit slapped me SO hard and was like "Really Danika!? How DARE you ask a question like that?! If you wake grateful and ungrateful people up EVERY day, heal the sick, give people what they want knowing they are only gonna take the shine for themselves and forget all about you, and many, many more things out the kindness of your heart, you wouldn't want or ask for anything in return??" And that's true. God asks nothing from us in return BUT to give Him the honor, praise, and glory. I mean, that's all we really CAN do. He has everything, He IS everything. So what can you give a person who has everything?? Nothing! But gratitude, recognition, and praise. I wrote about this before: In Deut 8:11-20 (NET) it tells us not to forget the Lord by not keeping his commandments, ordinances, and statutes and forgetting that it was HE who brought us from slavery and when we get all of these blessings to (V17) Be careful not to say, "My own ability and skill have gotten me this wealth". We must remember that He is the one who gives US the ability TO get wealth, and if we follow Him, He will fulfill His promises He gave to our ancestors many, many years ago (because He is a man of His word--unlike us humans), but if we do forget and follow other gods (wealth, power, greed, selfishness, gluttony; just to name a few), just like the many blessings He has gave us, He will surely destroy them and/or take them away because of our disobedience. And I can attest to that! I remember at one particular job I was making decent money (at that time) and was like, "oh yeah, I got it going on".. Well baby, let me tell you.. That job gave me SO many problems and I couldn't "save" like I was planning on and talking about doing because things just kept on popping up that I HAD to take care of! I wasn't tithing or anything either, giving NO reverence to God, needless to say that job diminished right in front of my very eyes. Smh.. But back to the subject at hand. There's this song I just absolutely LOVE called "My God is Awesome" by Charles Jenkins. Very few words, yet so, so meaningful. Not only does it tells how awesome He is, but is shows how sweet He is. God is probably thee sweetest person we will EVER meet and/or know. He doesn't want to see ANY of His children hurt, broken, in bondage, in pain, living below His means, etc. He wants the very best for us. He wants to protect us, heal us when we are broken, strengthen where we're weaken, forgive us and set us free, and for us to live more abundantly! Above all, I think the most awesomely sweetest thing He has done for ALL of us, saved and unsaved, was sending His ONLY begotten Son to die for our sins. If that's not an ultimate sacrifice then I don't know what is!! Being as God is omniscient, all-knowing, He knew there would still be folks against Him and running with the devil, and yet, He STILL allowed the humiliation, ridicules, beatings, taunting, and crucifixion to happen. That alone just makes my heart cringe and smile all at the same time. Knowing that when I was yet a sinner, God still smiled and had His hands upon me. That's just so sweet...and so awesome! Man, God is Good! (Nobody's background is squeaky clean, so let's not get it twisted folks!) Self. Well, He is who He is. He is Himself. Always has been, is now, and always will be. There is none like Him. Hebrews 13:8 (KJV) Jesus Christ the same yesterday, today, and for ever. He ain't changing and that's what makes Him so AWESOME!!! So go on ahead and reflect and don't forget to give God His props and thank Him for the many, many things He has blessed you with!! :) Thank you Jesus!! Smooches!!! -DanikaKayelle XOXO

item.title: It's not over...
item.dc:creator: Danika
item.content:encoded:
Ok, so I just took myself out on a movie date. I saw Lee Daniel's "The Butler". I won't comment on the movie, but I'm probably not with the majority on that one. Anywho, as I'm driving home, jamming to my lil CD, the song "It's not over (When God is in it)" by Isreal & New Breed...and as I'm driving, I just get hit with a whole bunch of emotions. I start thinking about my grandfather and how much I miss him (he passed away 7/2/13) and then the tears started welling up in my eyes, and I'm like, "I'm not gon cry, I'm not gon cry" and as I'm saying that to myself and the song playing "its not over, its not over" I just start boohooing!!! Aaaaaah!! I wasn't all hyperventilating and snotting and things, but the tears just wouldn't stop falling! I mean, good thing I was doing the speed limit and was in the slow lane. Yeesh! But I just start thinking about how much I miss my grandfather and how he's not gonna be here for my wedding day (claiming it) and to see my children he was begging me for before he passed and witnessing me obtain my Masters and my relationship with God blossoms, and so many other things and it just brought tears to my eyes, and is bringing tears to my eyes now! Then, as I'm thinking bout that I realized the movie may have affected me more than I thought and the song was just a confirmation of it all. It's not over. We, as blacks or coloreds or what have you, fought, been through, and overcame SO much! And for a second, it's pretty normal to be biased, but it got me thinking, if other races, nationalities, or ethnicities were getting so much media like Blacks, will we see all the things that goes on with them?? I mean, I'm sure there's some struggles, discriminations, and things amongst them as well!? We all are fighting for something! We're all living, hoping, dreaming, wishing, and praying to achieve something and to reach our full potential (or so I would hope) and I am here to tell you that it is not over! I know me grieving over my grandfather is not over. I may not cry all the time and be able to smile a little more, but its still gonna be there. And that's fine! He was a good man.. But nevertheless, its not over. Life is not over, we still gotta live and keep on moving. That song, and yes, its pretty long, just gave me even more confirmation on my life and inspired me to write and encourage someone. Whatever the situation is, whatever the problem, issue, or complication is, it is not over hun. When God is in it and it is to His glory, please believe that it will prosper. I remember my Pastor, Tracy Casby, Sr., once stating, "Don't let fear paint you a vision" and "Don't live in a dream but in faith. A dream only lasts while you are sleeping". I should take my own word with that whole fear phrase...my shyness/stage fright is REAL, blah...but really, if you are a child of God and have faith that through Him all things are possible, then what looks like it's going to fail or you are never gonna get out of a situation or predicament that you are in, let me tell you that it is not over until God says it is. This is only a season and seasons MUST past! Have a great night and be blessed!!
-DanikaKayelle XOXO

item.title: If you want the impossible, you have to believe the impossible...
item.dc:creator: Danika
item.content:encoded: I woke up with this heavy on my heart. A lot of things we believe and want Jesus to do for us, are mostly all impossible and only He can do them! The Bible tells us in Matthews 21:22 (KJV) And all things, whatsoever ye shall ask in prayer, believing, ye shall receive. Now, as humans, that is quite hard for us to do. We have the mindset of "show me and I'll believe" and a lot of people in the Bible had that mindset also. God did prove Himself to be in a lot of instances. Matthews 9: 28-30 (NET) When He went into the house, the blind men came to Him. Jesus said to them, "Do you believe that I am able to do this?" They said to Him, "Yes, Lord". Then He touched their eyes saying, "Let it be done for you according to your faith. And their eyes were opened...". The impossible. You see, it was a simple question, a simple answer, a simple task for Jesus to do. Now, I know He could have just touched them without asking if they believed and healed them, but Jesus didn't operate like that. He knew who He was, He wanted and needed the people to know for themselves who He was and who He is. [We as His people need faith!] He didn't have anything to prove, He placed people's healing into their own hands. And you know something, I kind of like that about Jesus. Even when a person came to ask Him a question, He turned it around, spoke a parable, and made them see and answer it for themselves. Believe it or not, Jesus was a simple man. We pretty much make Him complicated. Now! Here's the kicker!! V21 does not say WHEN we shall receive it, but it says we shall receive. So! Just because it does not happen right when you pray about it does not mean it wont happen at all. Habakkuk 2:3 (KJV) says: For the vision is yet for an appointed time, but at the end it shall speak, and not lie: though it tarry, wait for it, because it will surely come, it will not tarry. In other words, He knows everything right? So He knows what it is that you will be praying for, okay. So the vision is for an appointed time, and at the end of that time, it will give a result, a testimony, that even if you wanted to, it could not be a lie, and even though it may take a while, you just wait, (and if you believe), it will come and be right on time! Ha! You see, I think God does this because He knows how we  operate. I know there were times when I prayed for God to get me out of a certain situation, take some things from me, heal me from  some other things, and He came thru! Rather quickly on some things, and what did I turn around and do?! Praise and thank Him in that moment and went right on ahead bringing myself back into that same situation/predicament. Some things are gonna come or happen before other things, but please don't get discouraged. God works on His own time, always have and always will. We could ask and tell Him a specific time frame and believe on it, but that doesn't mean He will give us that. He knows what He's doing. He's making us wait because it may be something we need to see in the process, grow, do, or work on in that process. If patience not one of your strong points, I'm more than sure He wont snap His fingers and give to you today! God truly gives the hardest battles to His strongest people. And normally, those are the people who feel they are too weak to take on the task. But trust God, He knows what He's doing. I believe that He does everything for a reason. If you don't know what that reason is, go to Him with a sincere heart and ask Him to show you. Maybe the reason is to strengthen your relationship with Him, or to finally see and accept Him as Lord and Savior. At those times when He was coming through for me so rapidly, He was also knocking at my heart. But clearly at those times, I wasn't ready to fully give it to Him. So I ask you, what it is that you are asking God to do? Do you truly believe it will come to pass or you say it with your heart, but doubt it in your head??? But he must ask in faith without doubting, for the one who doubts is like a wave of the sea, blown and tossed around by the wind. For that person must not suppose that he will receive anything from the Lord, since he is a double-minded individual, unstable in all his ways. James 1:6-8 (NET) Don't miss out on your blessing(s) trying to rush through your lesson(s). "(Job said) He may not come when you want Him, but He'll be there right on time. He's an on time God, yes He is". Dottie Peoples' song: "He's an on time God" Be blessed.. -DanikaKayelle XOXO

item.title: You never know what God is doing and/or who God is using.
item.dc:creator: Danika
item.content:encoded: So much, I don't even know where to begin. Every morning I'm just bombarding with thoughts. This particular morning, I woke up thinking about Jesus and His disciples. Now, I won't front like I know them like the back of my hands because I don't but what I DO know is that they were ordinary men and one was a tax collector who I believed was hated by the Jews. I like how this online article I ran across by Mary Fairchild talks about the disciples. She says, "Interestingly, not one of the chosen 12 disciples was a scholar or rabbi. They had no extraordinary skills. Neither religious, nor refined, they were ordinary people, just like you and me. But God chose them for a purpose—to fan the flames of the gospel that would spread across the face of the earth and continue to burn down through the centuries. He selected and used each of these regular guys to carry out his exceptional plan". Awesome right!? So thinking about the disciples got me to thinking about me and messages over the time I have received on how positive I am, or how I inspire people and how much people are proud of me and my "new change of life". It shocking! No lie.. Sometimes I still sit back and wonder "Why me"? Like I wasn't a bad person or really lived a bad life, but the way I was living and things I was doing were none of Him and yet He still saw fit! [And I still mess up and am far from perfect!] Guess that just means that its time for me to stop questioning. You see, God knows what He is doing and who He will be using and how. Its always people you least expect. I know I stated in my first post: "Destiny. Purpose. What is it? What's my gift?" about how God uses and loves the brokenhearted. These 12 ordinary guys with no bomb diggity background went around doing the works of God. They dropped everything and lived, followed, and obeyed strictly off of faith! Yes, sometimes they did question (so nothing's wrong with that), but most of all, regardless of the outcome, THEY STILL DID!! How many of us can say that!? Anywho, I feel myself getting off subject. So! A couple scriptures comes to mind regarding this topic. Luke 6: 27-28 (KJV): "But I say unto you which hear. Love your enemies, do good to them which hate you. Bless them that curse you, and pray for them which despitefully use you", Romans 12:15 (KJV) "Rejoice with them that do rejoice, and weep with them that weep", John 13: 34-35 (KJV) "A new commandment I give unto you, That ye love one another; as I have loved you, that ye also love one another. By this shall all men know that ye are my disciples, if ye  have love one to another". You never know who you will need or who will need you. That's why its best to never "burn bridges". It's so hard to love your enemies, turn the other cheek, rejoice with those who are doing well and you're doing not so well, and loving everyone when so many people are totally not loveable!! But guess what!!?!?! Jesus had a whole traitor following Him who released Him to the hands of His killers and what He did!? He loved him, blessed him, prayed for and with him, rejoiced with him, mourned with him and whatever else. He let it be known that He knew about "Judas", but He didn't call no names or anything. You know good and well, we would have been like, "A traitor is amongst us, JUDAS" and put Him all out on blast! But no-no!! We are not to do that. God handles our lightweight. Love everybody, speak to a stranger you're passing up on the street, give a "bum" a dollar. You just never know who or where YOUR next blessing will come from! Each day we should be thriving to be more like Christ. Don't worry bout your past, the Bible says "Therefore if any man be in Christ, he is a new creature: old things are passed away; behold, all things are become new." 2 Corinthians 5:17 (KJV) Learn to let things go. That same person that you can't stand because this reason or that reason could just so happen be the thing stopping you not only from getting into Heaven, but from receiving many, if not all of your blessings!! Jesus didn't say you have to be best friends with everyone, He said to love one another and guess what!? You can love from a far!! Say whaaaaat!?!?!? My Pastor always say he doesn't hold anyone in his heart so I am here to tell you.. Don't hold anyone in your heart BUT have Jesus in your heart and be blessed!! -DanikaKayelle XOXO

item.title: People are watching...Eyes are everywhere!
item.dc:creator: Danika
item.content:encoded:
So yesterday evening as I was walking to class, this random dude asked me what was wrong with me and I was like, "nothing", because really, I was having a great day! He said he asked because it looked like I had "something on my mind" and if he was timid, he would not have said anything and it lead me to thinking, and now I'm here blogging. How do you look when you think other people are not around or looking??? Obviously, there are people watching; eyes are everywhere. Now, I don't know ANYONE who are like all smiles 24/7, but are you totally unapproachable?? Jesus was approachable every second of the day. People who no one else wanted to be bothered with and everyone judged even felt He was welcoming. As a Christian, are you welcoming to the "outside world" or you're so high and mighty that only those of "your kind" can approach you? Now me, I say that I don't like people [working on it], but in reality, I am a people person, and crazy as that is, a lot of random people do come and approach me. Yeah, sometimes in my head, I'm like, "why is this person talking to me", but then I have to think....What if Jesus thought like that? It should be a daily desire to be more Christ like each day He bless you with another opportunity to see life. Is it easy?? Well, nah...not at all!! There's always "running late", "traffic", "person cutting you off", "oversleeping", "no milk", "can't find your keys", "kids are screaming", "accidents", or whatever else stumbling block there is to ruin your morning, WHICH sets the course of your day. But my dear, you have OPTIONS!!! Yeaaaaah!!! Options are good....some of the time. Here, you have the option to let it ruin your day and you have that look on your face that if somebody looks like they have a smile on their face you're going to slap them silly, OR you have the option to say, "You know what, I am going to brush that off and start having a great day now!" Truth be told, it will be much more easier and pleasant to go on ahead and brush that off. Everyone has their good and bad days. My good outweighs my bad and I believe realizing that makes it much more easier for me to brush things off. We all have our seasons, no one is exempt. But the great thing about seasons are they are only temporary. That's awesome!! Seasons in this instance can correlate with emotions and feelings. Most of the time, that stuff is temporary. Hunger, thirst, like, lust, anger, depression...temporary, for the most part. Tricky thing is what and how do you feed those seasons??? You feed hunger and thirst and you're no longer hungry or thirsty. Feed like...may grow in to love. Feed lust, well....that never really turned out good for me, neither has feeding anger and/or depression. {And I was feeding that with alcohol mainly. But anywho!} Options, decisions....God has control, be He gives those things to us. Choose wisely.

So now, think about it. On the inside (as Christians), you should be filled with The Spirit, which should be glowing on the outside, right?? What is dimming your light?? If strangers were mirrors, would you like what you see in them??? I do believe that this is what gives Christians a bad name or have people looking at a lot of folks with the side eye when they claim to be a "child of God". A tree is known by the fruits it produce (Matthews 12:33 (NET): "Make a tree good and its fruit will be good, or make a tree bad and its fruit will be bad, for a tree is known by its fruits"). I'm sorry, but you can't be no child of God tearing down the next person, judging, or claiming to be perfect and sinless, REGARDLESS of how often you go to church or how many scriptures you can quote or call out! Just how you have access to those things, so does the devil. Please believe. I been wanting to blog about the different types of "folk" there is out there, but haven't got my full confirmation for it and I try not to write until I do so that it can all come together and hopefully be able to confirm something in someone else, but its gonna come because I believe that there is a lot of "church folk" out there which gives "real Christian folk" a bad name and turn a lot of people away from God and the truth. That still brings me to what I am talking about here though. How are you being portrayed?? People are watching....are you a pleasant or unpleasant sight?? Are you approachable or run people away?? How do you walk, or as my Pastor would say/ask, "How you livin'"?!

{{{Check out Ephesians chapter 5}}}

Toodles!!

-DanikaKayelle XOXO

item.title: Women!!!!!!!!!! Take heed......
item.dc:creator: Danika
item.content:encoded: Awe man!! So much I want to blog about!!!!!! This has been a very tremendous week! Out of all the events that took place, one particular thing stood out. This morning as I was getting ready for work, I was reflecting on the past days. Now, I've always been pretty close to my family and things, but when my grandfather took sick, I was a sleep in at my grandmother's house and then when he passed away, I just pretty much moved in. I don't think my grandmother is like any other grandmother. I'm inside more than her, but she's so cool, down to earth, and humble. Her and my grandfather used to go out to eat on Thursdays and I basically keep up the tradition. Thursday past (yesterday) was VERY insightful!! We shared laughs, stories, and advice. So this morning as I'm giving thanks to God; it just hit me. Like I am SO grateful to have my grandmother in my life and I wish that she and I were spending this time together prior to why we do it now. Titus 2: 3-5 popped up in mind (NET) "Older women likewise are to exhibit behavior fitting for those who are holy, not slandering, not slaves to excessive drinking, but teaching what is good. In this way they will train the younger women to love their husbands, to love their children, to be self-controlled, pure, fulfilling their duties at home, kind, being subject to their own husbands, so that the message of God may not be discredited". These are the things that she was pretty much teaching me and telling me about. I am no feminist or what have you, but I do believe that as women, we really have and hold much more power than we think! I believe that since Eve was the first to take bite of the fruit, people just automatically equate that with women being weak. But if you look closer in to it, Satan went to Eve because she was the stronger one, and he knew once he broke through to her, that he could get to Adam. And not to mention, it is called "the fall of man" not "the fall of Eve or Adam". Anywho! All throughout the Bible there are stories of many, many great women making sacrifices and having authority. When I read about or hear stories about some of the sacrifices that the women made it makes me think about the ultimate sacrifice Jesus made. WOMEN ARE POWERFUL! So women, I truly encourage you to take a look inside yourself and see your true beauty. For so long we have be downplayed, misused, abused, and mistreated by quite a few people we "loved" I'm sure. But in reality, we are here to uplift, love, nurture, and care for others. We are "helpmeet" to man. Not equal to man to be in competition with, but to help him accomplish what it is that he is set out to accomplished. Through women, men and others are blessed. Helping others is how we are blessed. Now, I am in no way, shape, or form saying to go out there being a "duck" for every guy you meet! There is ONE guy for you. But what if you passed your "one guy" limit?? Sweetie, if you're not married to the RIGHT man, then you have not passed it up. It is not too late to get yourself on the right path. So what? You didn't save yourself until marriage from the very beginning. I am here to tell you the beginning is NOW! Make it up in your mind to become a better you, a woman of God, a woman of Virtue, fearfully and wonderfully made, a Proverbs 31 woman!! It's never too late to start over new. Yeah, so what!? You had a past. We all did! But when I tell you repentance is one great of a thing. God washes your slate CLEAN.... The old you is no more!! Once you set in your mind that you are more, you need and deserve more, God will open so many doors for you. You will easily see who's there for you and who's not. Who you are to help and who you are to flee from. When you transform, you're gonna rub your eyes and be like, "Man! This is what I've been missing?!" So many people will respect you. Regardless if they agree with your decision, new lifestyle, or what have you. You are going to have such a new glow and demeanor about yourself its crazy!! Oh, but it will get trying!! Going from what your knew to something new will always be a challenge, but each obstacle you overcome, the stronger you will be and the deeper your faith will get. You are going to see and realize so much for and about yourself that settling will NEVER be an option again! God wants all of His children to have the very best. Now that I'm "pure" I'm starting to realize WHY He wants each and everyone of us to be so until marriage. Sex/lust with someone that's not for you will open lots of gateways for so many things to come in and play against you. It'll have you feeling things that's not true, do things that's not you, questioning every little thing that goes on or happen, and leave you alone and broken hearted. God created sex to be a beautiful thing. Something for one man and one woman to enjoy. In all honesty, I'm looking for to after saying  "I do" to get it on and popping! I can only imagine how amazing that connection will be!! Man!!! Off subject...let me get back! I didn't even want to talk about sex and saving yourself, I wanted to talk about having an older woman as an influence in your life. It may not be a relative, it could be a teacher, an elder, someone else's mother, cousin, grandmother, whomever! But it should be someone. Someone you can see the fruits of their labor. My grandmother was definitely a helpmeet for my grandfather. She didn't work a day in her life for man, but she worked for her man if you get my drift. My grandfather took care of her and she took care of the house and kids. (Proverbs 31). She practiced submission and yet, still had authority. She stroked his ego and let him know he was loved and appreciated. She let him be a man, thee man, the head of their house! She was always presentable when she went out because she knew who and what she represented. Now that I have new eyes, she is truly an inspiration to me. And in my single days, I am still working on transforming my mind and breaking old and bad strongholds the past had (past tense..claiming it!) on me! I am striving to be that Proverbs 31 woman and when God sees fit to send me my "Adam" [Boaz], man, HUSBAND, I want to be fully prepared and aware of what it is that I need to do! And being as I don't believe in divorce, I trust God that when dude puts a ring on this here ring finger of mine that that will be it. There will be no "ifs, ands, or buts" about it, but "where do I sign"!!?! It's time that we, women, take back control and go out and do what it is that we were created and set out to do. Quit letting a man run you down and allow God to lift you up and fill that void you're trying to fill with man. Can't nobody fill it but Him. Stop wearing yourself thin and beating yourself up. You are much more than a female dog and what's between your legs. The generational curses stops with YOU!! Be an example. Yield towards "older women" and yield to become someone else's "older woman"! -DanikaKayelle XOXO

item.title: ...and the church say.....
item.dc:creator: Danika
item.content:encoded: Well, for folks who are close around me have heard and known that I've been TWEAKING to write a blog about "Church folk" and other folks but I've never received my confirmation to do so. I figured out why that was so. I was trying to go about blogging it the wrong way. In my head, it looked like it was going to be like a "calling out" type thing and that's not how I want to come of or portray my blogging to be. So I was told to just share my experience and opinions on it and here it is... I grew up in a church. My grandfather made sure we were there every Sunday and Tuesdays for Bible Study. Now as kids, you really have no choice to do so. So yeah, I went...faithfully! Especially since we went to McDonald's immediately following! But as I got older and was able to make my own decisions, I started viewing church differently. I knew right from wrong, believed there was a God, and that Jesus died and rose up again for our sins. I knew about asking for forgiveness and all that jazz. Now, even though I knew all of that, I still chose to do my own thing. When I felt I did REALLY bad, I would be like "Man! I need to go to church" or quickly say "God forgive me" or when I remembered to pray, I would make sure before I say "Amen" to ask for forgiveness. That lifestyle became routine or like a norm to me because I've experience FIRST hand people who went to church FAITHFULLY, praising, screaming, hollering, and everything and in the next breath cursing folk out, talking bout what such and such had on at church, or how much such and such ain't no good, they wrong for coming to church knowing God knows what their doing, sloppy drunk, fornicating, committing adultery, and so on and so forth. So naturally, I'm like, "Man, all this is just a show!" But in reality, something in me just felt like that wasn't right and every time that would happen, I would shake my head and be like, "this can't be right". So at one point, I went shop around. I went to visit quite a few different churches: Full Gospel, Jehovah Witness, Pentecostal, Catholic, and other Baptist churches...and believe it or not, I was seeing the SAME thing there!!! So I was like, "What they hay, I might as well stay where I'm at". But as time went by, I was just totally unhappy. Filling voids almost every which way I could, yet nothing sufficed. I remember "I need to find a real good church home" being said over and over and my head and sure enough, one day, I was introduced to it! I will never forget that day, in Dillard's lingerie dept. dressing room, back in 2008 I believe, when a Sister from my church where I am now (Full Life Faith Ministries) came in and all of a sudden started fellowshipping with me. She said she felt it in her Spirit to pray for me, and I allowed her to do so, and she then invited me to her church. I went, and at that time, we were having church outside! Rain, heat, cold, WHATEVER, it was happening. It was a TOTALLY different atmosphere from what I was used to: speaking in tongues, crying, radical praising, etc. The way Pastor spoke and still speak is just SO real. He shows he's human and that he's flawed and teaches strictly on and from the Bible. Not no man made laws and rules, but those only of and from God!! Now, I don't know anyone who can't appreciate that. Hebrews 13:9 (NET) says: "Do not be carried away by all sorts of strange teaching. For it is good for the heart to be strengthened by grace, not ritual meals, which have never benefited those who participated in them". Don't flee from where you just may need to be just because it's different from where you came... You're leaving that place for a reason right??? So let me go on ahead and clear this out now! I do NOT in no way, shape, or form think that my church is the best church in the whole wide world and that everyone should belong to it because its the realist! NO! But for ME, it is!! It is where The Lord placed me to be. And He has a place for you, but it takes YOU to go out and seek it. When people invite you to church, go on ahead and accept that invitation. You designate your time to everything else, what's an hour or two for God. He allows you to have the rest of the day to do whatever (besides sinning). I remember my Pastor saying at the last Bible Study (Wed nights for 7pm) that if you're in a church where you think all they want is your money (they have those), you need to leave or be delivered. If you don't believe in your leader, you won't grow or be blessed and you don't need to be under them. He also mentioned that there has to be proof of your ministry, life changing proof. And I believe that's the difference. The Bible says in Hebrews 13:7 (KJV) "Remember them which have the rule over you, who have spoken unto you the word of God: whose faith follow, considering the end of their conversation". In other words, your leader should be producing proof of his ministry. There should be some type of growth and change amongst his people. I can attest that my life has changed tremendously since rejoining my church. Didn't go into detail about the first time, but long story short, I allowed someone to turn me away from the church because of their actions, which brings me to this. There is no "perfect" church where EVERYone is a SAINT! In all honesty, there's always going to be somebody in the church who are just playing or that you know who just not no good. But its not about them, it is about you! You are accountable for your own works/words/deeds. 2 Corinthians 5:10 (KJV) "For we must appear before the judgment seat of Christ: that every one may receive the things done in his body, according to that he hath done, whether it be good or bad". Rebecca Sue May can't stand before God on my behalf. God is going to politely (or not so politely) shut that down and say, "Danika...this is all about you sweetheart and what you have done with your life", whether I know Him or not. That verse says "every one" not "just the saved ones" or "only those in the church", but EVERY one. Sinner, saint, whore, pimp, good person, bad person, wicked person, drug addict, drug dealer, murderer, thief, Pastor, Deacon, Usher, Member, atheist, Non-denomination, Baptist, Catholic, Muslim, Democrat, Republic, White, Orange, Norwegian, Black, Mulatto, rich, poor, sick, whatEVER, you WILL be judged!! Your body will go back to where it came as will your spirit and soul. Ecclesiastes 12: 7 (KJV) "Then shall the dust return to the earth as it was: and the spirit shall return unto God who gave it". Lastly, I just want to say that no, I do not believe that the only way you will get to Heaven is by going to church, but is it by Jesus Christ (John 14:6). Truth be told, The Lord comes on a Sunday morning to take His people, I truly believe that a lot of churches will still be full: Pastors, Bishops, Preachers, and all. What I do believe and can testify is that church serves as (some folks heard this before) a gas station. Yes, you should know God on your own, outside of church, pastors, or whom/whatever. Its a personal relationship that no one else can have like you because it is specifically designed for you and Him, but church should be to refill/refuel you. Church should be a place where you get confirmations and convictions about things God has for you, placed on you, or you guys talked about. If your spirit is not getting fed, just like the body, it weakens and then you lose sight. My prayer is that everyone who is seeking a relationship with God and to better themselves and their lives find the right place for them, under the right leadership ordained by God, to teach them and mold them to be better Christians and people. And hey! If you're content where you are and the way your life is going, I am in NO way to judge, do you boo boo! Be the best whatever you can be. Whether its sinner, drinker, smoker, fornicator, atheist, saint, whatever, be the best "that" you can be. Just don't be a hypocrite. Man up and own up to your stuff. Don't go and blame Jesus for something you clearly did on your own. He gives us the right to make our own decisions. He don't force Himself on us. Revelation 3:20 (NET) "Listen! I am standing at the door and knocking! If anyone hears my voice and opens the door I will come into his home and share a meal with him, and he with me". Right there, its letting you know how He is. He is going to knock and IF anyone hears and open will He come in. The choice is yours. He don't force Himself on anyone...and with that being said, CHRISTIANS, let us not force God and/or church on people. But as stated today in church, you cannot be a dictator, instead, be an example and people will follow. That's my nightly prayer, to be an example and influence to draw people closer to God through my ways, actions, decisions, and faith. Amen. -DanikaKayelle XOXO

item.dc:creator: Danika
item.content:encoded:
Dear friends,
This may be the most hardest, yet cleaning blog I will ever post. What I'm going to do here is call myself out and set a mirror in my face and tell my self off! You see, this past week, I've been reading other blogs, talking and sharing with friends, and just on yesterday, I'm giving advice to someone to let "it" out. And you know how they say, "people can give advice but can't take their own"... I'm gonna attempt to take my own.. So buckle up your seatbelts my dear friends...the journey shall begin.
Everyone has a story and all of them are different, yet most of them are the same. The thing is, no one wants to share their story. Whether it's because of embarrassment, they're scared, or straight up judgment. When people know the truth about you, there's always gonna be a "let me tell you"..but you don't do it for them, you share for the "I needed to hear this". Since darn near the whole world likes to be silent, you never know who needs to hear your story or who you will affect! I can tell you first hand, from being the queen of repressed memory, that I thoroughly enjoy hearing and reading other people's story. I admire their bravery for sharing and I won't lie, sometimes, no judgment at all, I see that my tale is not always as bad as I make it seems. It is a true fact that their is somebody who always has, have, or had it worst than you. And guess what!? You're included in that too! So don't think your life is always above another's cuz it's not. You're "horrible" situation, shines light on another's situation.
Hmmm, so let's get into it. Mirror, mirror on the wall, what is it that I should share with the world?????
I am much more of a happy person now. I have, or so I thought, let it all go. But believe it or not, there will always be a time where those things you "let go" of, will creep right back up and present itself again. It may be a person, a phrase, a place, a song, a saying, a scent, a number, a date, anything!

item.title: Ready, set, SLIDE!
item.dc:creator: Danika
item.content:encoded: I been sitting on this blog for almost a month now and in all honesty, I wanted to finish it last week, but I just been too lazy to do so! Every free time I had to myself, I wanted to sleep and that ain't right and yet, this blog will be so fitting.! I hear my Pastor say often, "Jesus is married to the backslider". At first, I really was struggling to understand that and didn't think it was like a big deal, but in all honesty, that is a HUGE deal!! In the dictionary, backslide is defined: to start doing bad again after you have stopped it, to lapse morally or in the practice of religion, and to revert to a worse condition. Basically backsliding is going back to wherever you came from. Its the being saved, but slipping back into the world, its the finally free from an abusive relationship, but going back months later because "they've changed", its repeating history all over again when you started writing a new book, or it can be as simple as slacking up in the things that you know you should be doing as a Christian (spending time with God, reading and studying His Word, attending church, praying, etc). Funny thing is I haven't even begin to look for passages, but God makes His presence known. The other morning when I woke up, first thing I normally do is grab my phone. Now, in the beginning (of being saved), I would go to my Bible app and read some scriptures, but this particular morning, as I tapped on my Instagram app, I realized that I slid  aaaaalllll they way back! So, I closed it out, went to my Bible app and went to the daily readings for that day and lo and behold, it takes me to Jeremiah chapter 3. As I begin to read, I get to V6 and it says (KJV), "The Lord said also unto me in the days of Josiah the king, Hast thou seen that which backsliding Israel hath done? she is gone up upon every high mountain and under every green tree, and there hath played the harlot." Funny right?? Then it goes on and say that God (V7) "put her away and had given her a bill of divorce." See, He's married to the backslider. When I think of marriage, I think of commitment, vows, oath, love, lifetime, happiness, trials, tribulations, test, and testimonies. I think of soul mate and that there is no one else. I think "this is it" and that's what it should be. Now, if Jesus is married to the backslider, with my thinking of what marriage is, I would say that He is one crazy man! Marrying, committing to , taking vows with, loving, having a lifetime of happiness with someone who falls off and/or goes back to where they came from. But really, He's not crazy because 9xs out of 10, MOST, no, Ima go out on a limb here and say ALL Christians backslide and if Jesus wasn't married to them, then how would they come or be welcomed back??? That's true, powerful, and agape love. This is why God IS love (1 John 4:8; 16). Only He can really possess this kind of love and it doesn't phase him. Before you are saved, you are a sinner. Psalms 51:5 (NET) says: "Look, I was guilty of sin from birth, a sinner the moment my mother conceived me." So sin is in you and come on, its human nature to stick to things you know and what you're comfortable with. So as a sinner, you don't really think about "backsliding", you're already doing what it is you want to do, but as a Christian, you are made new, so what you used to do, you don't do anymore and that's where the backsliding comes into play. But guess what!? As I continued to read Jeremiah chapter 3, the Lord calls for Israel and Judah (who backslid as well) to repent. V12 (KJV) says, "Go and proclaim these words toward the north, and say, Return, thou backsliding Israel, saith the Lord; and I will not cause mine anger to fall upon you: for I am merciful. saith the Lord, and I will not keep anger for ever."...V14, "Turn O backsliding children, saith the Lord; for I am married unto you: and I will take you one of a city, and two of a family, and I will bring you to Zion."..V22, "Return ye, backsliding children, and I will heal your backslidings." Isn't He an awesome husband!? He wants to keep us, to stay married to us. He is merciful. He says it Himself and God cannot tell a lie! I mean, come on, let's face it. You WILL backslid, some more than others, but nevertheless, your day and time will come. How wonderful is it knowing that even though you will let Him down, He's still there with open arms, telling you what to do. Return. Although you strayed away, all you have to do is turn around and come on back. The remedy my Pastor has for backsliding is to "slide back". It's just that simple. God doesn't want to stay angry at you forever. He just wants you to admit your wrong doings and do better next time. His mercies NEVER run out, but that doesn't mean they are there to take for granted. So I leave you with this: Don't give up. If you backslid, don't stay there. Temporary feelings and happiness WILL wear off. Turn back and return to God. He wants you to do that and He will heal you of your backslidings. Repent to God and ask Him to show you how not to backslide again and allow Him to do so. You can and will outlive your last "mess up" and He's always looking to show you how He can turn your "mess" into your "best". Blessings. -DanikaKayelle XOXO

item.title: Jesus knows my heart, but........ Do you?!
item.dc:creator: Danika
item.content:encoded:
"Jesus knows my heart". That saying makes me laugh now. Yes, it is a true statement, but what makes it funny to me now is because we don't know our own hearts. I remember always saying that when my grandfather used to ask why I didn't go to church, but in reality, it wasn't in my heart; I would have went if it was. So me saying that was basically saying, "Jesus knows that's not in my heart to go", but truthfully, I really meant "He knows I really want to go". "Out of the abundance of the heart, the mouth speaketh" Matthew 12:34 (KJV). Jesus was not in my heart and my actions and words proved so. I know church is at the same time every week and yet, I used to do and plan for everything BUT that! I would wake up early 5-6 days a week and sleep in late on Sundays, but "He knows my heart". If I just so happened woke up on time to go to church and felt a smidget of me not wanting to get out the bed, I would say, "Jesus knows my heart" or "that was no body by the devil keeping me in". But you know, at some point, YOU have to take responsibility for your own actions! That was all me. I was content with the life I was living and I didn't want to be convicted of it, but I still was being convicted. If God has His hands on you, you can't really escape from that no matter how hard you try. I mean, you can't hide from Him. Adam and Eve can testify to that! Yesterday, Pastor said, "Jesus always find you where you are. You just have to get there. You are never in a place where Jesus cannot find you". Well, where He found me was the LAST place I expected to hear from Him, but hey, Jesus knew my heart. Flip side to that statement, I am happy that He knows my heart. Even though I was saying that but was showing different actions, I sincerely meant  the "right" thing to do. Then once I started to examine my own heart and get to know it, I realized I was just all wrong. I used to do and put everything before God and I wont lie, I still catch myself doing so even now, but its easier to see it and correct it now than it was back then. Being a Christian is a constant and daily progression. Just like with everything else, it takes work and it takes you doing a part. Actions, not just words. You cant just say, "yes, I'm a Christian" and still live worldly. Remember, Jesus knows your heart. So my question would be: Do you know your own heart and being as Jesus knows your heart, is it a product of Him and is He proud?? We must examine ourselves daily. 2 Corinthians 5:13 (KJV) tells us, "Examine yourselves, whether ye be in the faith; prove your own selves. Know ye not your own selves, how that Jesus Christ is in you, except ye be reprobates." You must know yourself to examine yourself and then you have to prove yourself....seeeeeee.....WORK!!!! You do a part!! I wish it WAS easy to just say and not do and still get all the results, blessings, favors, and things I want. I want a flat tummy SO bad, and yet, not doing anything about it. **le sigh**  Must not want it that bad huh!? Smh... But anywho! We will fail, but put it in your heart not to fail. Hide the Word in your heart, so that you may not sin against thee (Psalms 119:11, KJV). Get to know your heart like Jesus knows your heart. Prove yourself! Philippians 4:8 (KJV): "Finally brethren, whatsoever things are true, whatsoever things are honest, whatsoever things are just, whatsoever things are pure, whatsoever things are lovely, whatsoever things are of good report; if there be any virtue, and if there be any praise, think on these things".

Father God, I come to you today, praying for each and everyone of us. Praying that we take the time out to examine ourselves and see ourselves as You see us. Dear Lord, I pray that we begin to use our actions more than our words and that not only we prove ourselves, but we prove You to be who You are. In Jesus name.

Amen.

-DanikaKayelle XOXO

item.title: Just for once, outside of Thanksgiving, be thankful...
item.dc:creator: Danika
item.content:encoded: So look, before I can get any work done, I just have to get this blog out! Alright, so this morning I'm driving to work finishing my convo with God and then all of a sudden this came to me. I forwarded a message with some friends and added a touch of myself and at the end of the message. I said, "Smile through the pain and dance in the rain". At the time I sent the message, I was just like, "oh that's cool, I like that", but a couple minutes later the Holy Spirit spoke and then that quote spoke volumes to me! Who in the heck wants to smile through the pain and dance in the rain?! Me personally, I want to sleep during both! But it spoke to me and got me to thinking. It so many demands we as believers place on God. So many things we, even non-believers, trust and believe God for. We are always praying and asking him for things, when in reality, its so much that we already have that we should be thanking Him for. All the small and simple things. I then thought of that song, "My Worship is For Real". The words say "You don't know my story. All the things that I've been through. You can't feel my pain, What I had to go through to get here. You'll never understand my praise. Don't try to figure it out, Because my worship, My worship, Is for real". Everyone's background is different. We all came through and from different things, some not as bad as others, and some that may even been the same, but nevertheless, we all came and overcame some things. Yesterday at church, we shared testimonies. Just hearing and seeing how God has been working and blessing people touched me so much! Now if you don't believe in Him or have faith, then you will never get this and I pray for you, because you are surely missing out. One lady shared her testimony on how she went from working 8hrs a day to 2 hours a day! What!? She stated that she stayed faithful to her job and worked those 2hrs like they were 8, praying, asking, trusting, and believing God for another job.......Well needless to say, she was blessed with another job! Another one I'll share that just brought tears to my eyes was this one from a guy. When he was about 16, he was suffering from migraines and had no clue where they were coming from, so he went to the doctor and they drew some blood and it turned out he had Spinal Meningitis. Now, from what he shared, he said they were 2 different kinds, one that would definitely kill him and another that wouldn't. He said he was praying to a God that he didn't believe in and the results came back as the less threatening one and because of Him he is still here. Ha! Talk about God works!!! I guess the point of this blog is to finally, for once, not focus on the things God "need" to do for you, but to point out the things that He has already done. It's SO much we have to be grateful for and yeah, I know Thanksgiving is coming up, but I demand this challenge! Let's all take about 30 minutes out of our busy day from the things God has already blessed us with (school, kid(s), job, spouses) and just how as a child you wrote letters to a man that you've never seen and yet believed in, Santa Claus, write a letter to a Man that you are seeking to see and believe in, Jesus Christ, thanking Him for all of the things He's blessed you with. Get all to yourself and get real with yourself. Dig through all the old memories, whether good or bad, go back to those repressed memories and jot them all down. I bet you'll see more things that you have to be thankful for. Many situations you're going to think back on and realize it was nobody BUT God. If you want, you can comment and share here. Even though we didn't get a word from the Pastor, we got a word from others stories. Or at least I did! First lady said something yesterday that I liked to. I'm paraphrasing, but it was something along the lines of people not wanting to hear or believe that they received a word from God because it didn't come from the man of God, but God uses different vessels to deliver the same kind of water. I used to be like that, but now, I enjoy it from all kinds of ways. I love hearing personal testimonies. "Rejoice with those who rejoice, and weep with those who weep" Romans 12:15 (KJV). I guarantee there is a blessing in store for you. -DanikaKayelle XOXO

item.title: ...at the end of the day, when its all said and done, it is not about you. Has never been and never will be. Sad, honest, and awesome truth!
item.dc:creator: Danika
item.content:encoded: We, as humans, get so wrapped up in ourselves and what we think is right to where sometimes we blind ourselves from seeing what really is right! We justify things just to make ourselves feel better, when in reality, if we have to justify something, then it must not be right in the first place. 2 Timothy 4:3-4 (NET) "For there will be a time when people will not tolerate sound teaching. Instead, following their own desires, they will accumulate teachers for themselves, because they have an insatiable curiosity to hear new things. And they will turn away form hearing the truth, but on the other hand they will turn aside to myths". See, don't feel bad when this happen to you for it is written. V5 tells us what to do, "You, however, be self-controlled in all things, endure hardship, do an evangelist's work, fulfill your ministry". We are all here for a reason. God knew us before we were formed in our mother's womb (Jeremiah 1:5). Being as we know there is a season for everything, simply means we are going to go through everything. But you are to stand firm. Continue doing what you were called to do. Don't let other things alter or discourage you and get you off of your path. You decided to change for a reason, whatever that reason may be, in that moment you realized that doing things on your own led you nowhere and a change must take place. In the beginning, its awesome, you think you got it can't nothing stop you or steer you from venturing off and then the devil realize that you're doing TOO good for yourself. If you haven't been saved all your life, then you were once a follower of he, the devil. So guess what?! He knows you too! He knows what used to get you, what things you like, what things you yearned for, so he has means, sources, and things on you. He will dress whatever it is that you are praying and desiring for. If its love, he will dress it up and in chivalry, compassion, consistency, and all these other things that make you melt! But in reality, its not of God because although it makes you melt, it takes your mind elsewhere and the things we are told to think on (Philippians 4:8) goes out the window. It may not be love, it may be other things. You know what you're praying and believing God for. It could be a job, and one may come along that you believe is right for you, so you just jump on it only to realize that's not the one God have for you. You see, as much as we may think we do, we really don't know what we want or what's good for us and that's where the Holy Spirit comes in. He is in us for a reason. When you feel that "inkling" of something not working out, don't ignore it and try to fight it. Its there because He knows what's right for you and you fighting it is not doing anything but hindering your growth and stopping or prolonging what's to be right for you to come along. You have to keep reminding yourself daily that this is a FAITH walk. Hebrews 11:1 (KJV) says "Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen". You can't go off of what you see. You will never believe if you do that! True examples are those from the Old Testament, Hebrews 11 shares stories of some. They never seen Jesus, but believe God when He said that He will send a Messiah and they remained faithful to Him and had faith: Abraham, Moses, Sarah, Ruth, Daniel, Job, Isaiah, Samuel, David, just to name a few. We must follow in their footsteps. God fulfilled ALL of His promises to them, so what makes you different??? What makes you think He wont do the same for you.!? Rebuke that doubtful spirit, repent, and believe that what God says He will do, He will do! Reject self and accept help. Help from the right people though! Its a reason the Bible tells us not to be unequally yoked together with non believers (2 Corinthians 6:14). The two could never become one and fellowship. Philippians 2:2 (KJV) says: "Fulfil ye my joy, that ye be likeminded, having the same love, being of one accord, of one mind". If its two different worlds, two different feelings, how could something become one? One would have to change in order for that to happen. The "bad" would have to turn "good" or the "good" would have to turn "bad", but light and darkness cannot fellowship together. I am convinced that it is us that get in our own way. The Bible tells us in Luke 9:23-24 (KJV) "...If any man will come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross daily, and follow me. For whosoever will save his life shall lose it: but whosoever will lose his life for my sake, the same shall save it". IT IS NOT ABOUT YOU! Here are clear, cut, and precise instructions! We are to deny self DAILY. Instead of letting God be Him and allow Him to do what He do, we try to take matters in our own hands and then conflict comes into play. You may think it'll be easy to just go back to the "old" you, but if God has His hand on you, it would most likely not be a smooth transition. You are His lost sheep, once you are found; yeah, you may wander of, but I can surely guarantee you that you will be back! There is not greater love, no better feeling, than being there in the presence of God. Be Blessed -DanikaKayelle XOXO

item.title: Bye-bye self..
item.dc:creator: Danika
item.content:encoded:
Today, I just want to talk about getting rid of self. It has been my daily prayer for the past couple of weeks to free myself from me. Since the beginning of time, the fall of man, we have been selfish people. The Bible speaks and teaches on selfishness and tells us how not to be selfish. 2 Timothy 3: 1-5 tells us (NET):: "But understand this, that in the last days difficult times will come. For people will be lovers of themselves, lovers of money, boastful, arrogant, blasphemers, disobedient to parents, ungrateful, unholy, unloving, irreconcilable, slanderers, without self-control, savage, opposed to what is good, treacherous, reckless, conceited, loving pleasure rather than loving God. They will maintain the outward appearance of religion but will have repudiated its power. So avoid people like these." Although, for the most part, they are speaking about the church, which I'm sure we all can agree that this is true for most churches, but it also brings light to the people of "today's society" as well. The Bible tells us to love one another but ourselves tells us, "I don't like that person, (s)he didn't speak to me, so I'm not speaking to them". Man..let that evil spirit GO! It is not about you..! Jesus was a selfless man. He did nothing that He wanted to do, but everything that He was told to do by His Father. He is thee ultimate example of who we should be yearning to be like. Now, I'm not saying go out and be all fake about everything, trying to be all happy go luck when really you don't wanna be, God sees and reads your heart. Start off by praying about it. Ask God for discernment, ask Him to show you how to be happy when speaking to someone you know thinks ill about you. Ask Him to show you how to put someone else before you (not before Him tho) without losing yourself in the process. Ask Him to show you how to rejoice with others in their joyous times when yours is dark. Ask Him to show you how not to be selfish. Pastor just spoke last Sunday on surrendering it all and how it's a process. I haven't even been saved for a full year yet and I am learning that just about everything is a process! Some things will come quickly and some things will not. But just how it took a process for you to get to where you are now..it's gonna take a process to get you to where you're going to be! Each day I feel myself being freed from myself and it's a wonderful feeling. My prayers I feel are getting better, my faith is getting stronger, and my relationship with myself and other people seems to be blossoming more. I think a lot of fear comes from the "what if" mindset and that's just another mechanism of our own selves getting in the way of potential destiny. Sometimes you have to take that risk regardless of what that "what if" is. And guess what!? It just so happens that "what if" was true, you canNOT let that linger on with you because it will hinder you! Appreciate it for what it was, take from it what you need to take from it, learn from it, and continue to seek and continue to grow and go forward. Some things are either a lesson or a blessing..and sometimes it may be both! And yes, I know that things are "easier said than done", but as stated before, it is a process. The more you do something the easier it will be. Praying for other people used to be hard for me. I was all about self and family. But just how you going through things and want your families to be safe, protected, healed, or whatever the case may be, so is someone else down the road praying, hoping, needing, and wishing the same thing. Now, I've been throwing other people in the mix and I have been seeing change and growth all around me. People don't even be realizing it, but I be knowing. Baby, prayer works! And when you bless others, God will surely bless you. Remember, not to do it for the glory of man, but for the glory of God. Matthew 6:1 (NET):: "Be careful not to display your righteousness merely to be seen by people. Otherwise you have no reward with your Father in heaven."
Be blessed. -DanikaKayelle XOXO
(P.S. I typed this from my phone, so please excuse the verses not being italicize. Will go back and correct and edit. No worries)

item.title: Welcome to my mind, my mental....
item.dc:creator: Danika
item.content:encoded: So yesterday, I had a moment. Started thinking about my grandfather and just couldn't take it anymore. Left Bible Study, rode around crying because I didn't want my grandmother to see me that way and have to deal with me. It's so much she do already and deal with, I didn't want to burden her. As I'm driving, I just couldn't help but to think of the "devil" himself. Ugh! Like he always been there, especially around my grandfather's passing. That's why I really hate to think about it or get sad about it because he was the one to comfort me and I know that's not a road that I need to be travelling on anymore. And even though I have somebody in my life that I believe I can go to in times like this, I just find it hard to do it. I guess because I don't really know like "where we stand", but then again, I guess I do...I don't know. I just much rather not think about it, but then, that's where my problem comes in. Blah! You know, I always thought that this whole "mate" thing would be easy once you start "living right", but I'm seeing its really not. Kinda a little bit more complicated/confusing sometimes.. From reading some people stories (females), it was always, "and I knew he was the one"...I'm beginning to question that though. Pretty much everywhere I read in the Bible so far, the man always knew the woman, since Adam, because woman came from man. "Bone of my bone, flesh of my flesh" Genesis 2:23 (KJV). So what I'm getting is that we are not supposed to know. But then I'm like, "that's crazy!" Woman should know to so it can save her time, energy, and all that jazz. And I'm guessing that's where the Holy Spirit and discernment comes in at. Women should not be searching or looking for a mate, he should be the one searching and looking for you (I get that). Women are to be so focused on God to where your spirit will draw his spirit to you, the one that God has specifically for you! So now, I'm back to questioning myself. Like I give my all when dealing with a person and then I fight myself like, "no Danika, don't be doing all that", but that's just me, that's in my nature. I believe you get what you give. Then I remember all the times I've been told "I'm too good" or "intimidating" or "worth more" and all that jazz and I'm just baffled! But in reality, I should be happy about that, because WHOEVER he is, must be some GREAT and GRAND individual for these people to see and recognize all of "this" in me and let it go. I don't know. I just try not to think about it...again! You know what else gets me tho!? Like when dudes be like, "you're single...do as you please". That slick side ticks me off! I don't really get that. I mean, obviously the person is single if they're asking you a question as to dating other people, so why even point that out AND if everything is all so fine and dandy, why would you basically give others permission to see the "greatness" this one person possess?? I guess that can be like a defense mechanism or like a ego thing from dudes, idk, but in my experience, I see it as dude just saying, "girl look, I don't care what you do because I don't care about you" and then when you go and "do as you please" it's a problem. **rolls eyes** This must be why I never was good at dating and just much rather dive in there head first.. The games...just stupid. **shrugs** But now I have to ask.......since being told that and feeling that's what it means....why don't you "do as you please"???? Hmmmm....maybe because the "please" is to continue doing what you're doing oooooooor is it because you don't want to lose or mess up what you already have going for you??? Whatever that may be!? **Sigh** Then, I see all these people in relationships "happy" (Quotes for a reason...never know the truth behind the smile), getting engaged, married, and having babies and I'm genuinely happy for them, but I'll be lying if I said I don't be feeling some type of way within myself. I don't be so much envious, but I always get down in the dumps. Like every time I see my nephew with his mom, I always want to cry. Like I want that....sooooooooo bad!! But I refuse to force it or settle for it. I just keep reminding myself that my time is coming and that there's a season for everything, and this is the time I need to be getting myself together. I remember my people always telling me that I'm always looking for the perfect relationship, which is not true! I'm so far from perfect that it would be extremely dumb of me to want that! Why would I want something I can't offer?! You'll probably never get perfection from me....but you'll get my very best! I remember Pastor saying one time, "The relationship becomes imperfect the minute YOU become a part of it." Now, how true is that!? I'm very closed when it comes to my feelings and stuff because when I was extremely opened with them.........ima just leave that alone, BUT I can say that I'm genuine and when I do open up, its very rare, sincere, and real. "Kindness for weakness" right!? Idk man....I always say me being me and me being single is bittersweet, but I can't help but to continue on being me and doing me until he comes and find his "helpmeet". If this was all over the place and/or confusing.....the only thing I can say is Welcome!! Now just imagine how I be feeling! **insert my favorite emoji here** <--some people would know what that is! haha -DanikaKayelle XOXO

item.title: Don't be such a punk!
item.dc:creator: Danika
item.content:encoded:
Flipping through the pages in my text book, I stopped on a page talking about suicide. It published some suicide notes people left behind and I read them and couldn't help but to feel like a drop in my heart. At first, I was like, "dang, these people was really like, 'bump this, I'm killing myself'" and then I got shook. I was one of them people. I contemplated suicide on numerous of occasions and attempted twice. Not something I go around broadcasting, but its the truth. Suicide does not have a face, a race, a class, an age; suicide comes in all different shapes, colors, sizes, and forms. I mean, don't get me wrong, I am UBERLY excited to not have successfully killed myself because I can live to say that that "low" at that time is not the worst, life has a strange way of unfolding things. For as far back as I can remember, I always felt unwanted. Hearing that you were a "trick" to get here, being rushed into school, witnessing domestic violence, being "touched" (and not by the Holy Spirit), called "ugly", "fat", being told "you'll never amount to anything", being called an "hoe" by your own family, only praised for doing good in school to rub it in the face of others and pretty much place your peeps on a pedestal, feeling unloved, unwanted, and like you didn't belong, losing yourself for the sake of "having a man (or woman)"; its pretty easy to want to escape that FOREVER! I remember always feeling like I didn't have any one to talk to because no one would understand. I was always just told, "oh girl, you're over reacting, get over it" or called a "drama queen", then as I got older, it just became much easier to hold things in (working on it!). I used to talk to myself and cry myself to sleep plenty of nights, losing myself in songs, asking God, "why me, what have I done to deserve this!?" I've never been good at expressing myself verbally, but always been writing since a child.
