I remember cleaning out my room one day and finding things I've written but never gave to anyone and chuckled a little bit. I always thought I started writing back in the 10th grade after my first heartbreak, but I've been writing! How ironic is that!? In Jeremiah 1:5 (NET), God says, "Before I formed you in your mother's womb I chose you. Before you were born I set you apart." So now I'm seeing that while I was swarming around with my brothers and sisters that didn't make it, I was already DESTINED to be CHOSEN and SET APART. How cool is that!? Now if I would have succeeded in killing myself, I would have never read that verse a day in my life and realized this, because baby, let's be honest, before I rededicated my life to Christ, the only time my Bible got action was when I felt like I needed to go to church and that was only to read the verses talked about that morning. Nothing more, nothing less. The Bible is so interesting, I wish I would have been gotten into it, but it wasn't my time yet. I was still being worked on and still being worked on. But anywho, this blog is about suicide and the feeling of "unwantedness". Just listened to Sarah Jakes talk about being and feeling like an outcast. I'm sure quite of few of us feel this way, and I know I'm not alone in this. For that simple fact alone should give hope. There is life after hurt, that is joy after pain, that is smiling after the tears. I've been through so many lows in my life to where I figured I couldn't go back there anymore, but guess what?! I did!!! And I placed myself there from going against Him and what I knew. But now, even on my lowest days, I still smile and say, "God, I know there is much better than this and I am looking forward to it" and there is NO way I am saying that its all glitz and glam living a "saved" life, because it's not, you will still experience some things that life throws at you, but the difference now, for me at least, is that I have someone to go to and talk to when once upon a time, I wanted to die, or drink till I couldn't remember what caused me to drink in the first place, or get me some to "relieve some stress" and have temporary pleasure. Being as I see now what its like to not do those things and cast my burdens to Him, I would highly recommend it to all people. He don't want you to take your life or waste your life away, He wants to give you life so that you may live it to capacity and more abundantly! (John 10:10) In the words of Sarah Jakes, "God will not break you without purpose". Don't give up. Pastor once said, "Don't conclude life is over just because you are in a season. Just live another day. If it's bad and can't get any worse, why not live another day!?" Suicide is very cowardly, didn't know it at the time, but I know it now. Don't allow yourself to become such person, you are stronger than you think. Just look at the fact of how I just put myself on blast! And don't let NO body tell you who you are, what you will amount to, or talk down to and/or belittle you, because man has no say so, man has no control, BUT GOD! You tell them, and you stand on that, and you become that!

Romans 8:28 (KJV): "All things work together for the good  to them that love God"

Be encouraged and stay encouraged. -DanikaKayelle XOXO

item.dc:creator: Danika
item.content:encoded:
You ever look back on something and say to yourself, "What was I thinking?!" Sometimes I wonder if God says that to Himself with us. Like after He free us or deliver us from something and we go right back to it or after we ask Him for forgiveness and we go right back into the same sin. I wonder if He ever regret the things He's done for us. Like not killing us all or even giving His only Begotten Son for that matter!? But nah, cuz in John 3:17 it says that He sent Him not to condemn us, but that through Him we might be saved. So He knew what He was doing. God is so good with wordplay. Have you ever peeped that out?! Like every "all, some, might, will, shall, few, many", etc. are so strategically placed in its proper verse to where you can't do nothing but take it for what it is. "For MANY are called, but FEW are chosen." Matt 22:14 (KJV) "Not everyone who says to me, 'Lord, Lord,' will enter into the kingdom of heaven-only the one who does the will of my Father in heaven." Matt 7:21 (NET)
"When I think about Jesus and all He's done for me, when I think about Jesus and how He set me free, I can dance, dance, dance, dance, dance, dance, dance all night!!" No, really I can! Y'all, I really can't put in words all the things God has done for me and how I feel. I was scrolling down my Facebook of all my past posts, pics, and comments, and baby, let me tell you! I was one schizo/bipolar/lost little child. One minute I was in love, the next, cursing somebody out, then saying "Thank you Lord", and lastly in love with somebody else. Seemed like all in the same day or week! Crazy thing is I can recall who/what took place for me to post for the most part and let's just say I am happy those days are gone!

item.title: To forgive AND to forget....THAT is the answer...
item.dc:creator: Danika
item.content:encoded: Sometimes forgiveness is just as simple as saying, "I forgive you." I think that people tend, well I know that I tend, to "run" away from issues because I don't want to deal with them or face them, but let me tell you, they will NEVER go away unless you deal with them. I just had a recent, short, conversation with someone that I have been avoiding because I didn't want to deal with that particular situation and it was something that I was holding on to for YEARS....but you see, I was running from it and it kept coming back, catching up with me. You see, no matter how far ahead in the race you think you've gotten, it will always catch up with you, and if you don't deal with it, it will eventually win! You know the story about the tortoise and the hare. Well, the tortoise is your problem, and the hare is you. The hare thought he had it, but in the end, the tortoise won. Don't let tortoise beat you. Forgiveness is really, really, really a hard thing to do! And even after you forgive, its still work to do. What's that work?? Letting it go! Oh my gosh!!! We, as people, hold on to things for a looooooooong, long time! So, does that mean we truly  forgave?? We are taught to forgive and forget right? Isaiah 43:25 tells us that God "will not remember thy sins", so why should we remember those of others? Or even ours for that matter? Confession:: I have a not so clean background...but guess what!? I'm not the only one! Only person with a clean background WAS Jesus...none before and none after. So now, sitting here, typing this, in my head I'm like, "Man! I'm tripping"... What kind of jackoff am I being beating myself up off of things that happened in the past, holding on to hurt, anger, bitterness, and all those things that are NOT like Jesus and yet I want to be more like Him.!? Crazy right?? It is. As I was doing my research on the topic of forgiveness and forgetting I ran across a certain passage that opened my eyes. Now, I've read this book before, but I remember a Brother in the church saying how you can go back and read a passage again and notice a different scripture or read it in a different way, and I must say, this is one of those instances. Philippians 3:12-14 (NET) "Not that I have already attained this-that is, I have not already been perfected-but I strive to lay hold of that for which Christ Jesus also laid hold of me. Brothers and sisters, I do not consider myself to have attained this. Instead I am single-minded. Forgetting the things that are behind and reaching out for the things that are ahead, with this goal in mind, I strive toward the prize of the upward call of God in Christ Jesus." I read this and was like, "Pow! He told you!" This passage tells us that you never was perfect, but now, if you're saved, you're striving for better, so make up your mind and forget the things that are behind and go ahead and reach for that which is ahead. The prize is so much if only you would let go of what's holding back and move onward. So how about it?? Are you gonna make that phone call, send that text, write that letter, make it up in your mind, and/or look in the mirror and forgive whomever or whatever it is you need to forgive? Like Jesus asked the man at the pool, "Wilt thou be made whole?" God forgave, forgot, forgives you, and forgets your sins and as Christians, we are to be "Christlike"...so howsabout we be like our Father and take a page out of His book and follow His lead!? PS... 'Tis is easier said than done, so as I pray for myself in this area, I shall pray for you all who struggle here as well. Be blessed -DanikaKayelle XOXO

item.title: Who is God to you???
item.dc:creator: Danika
item.content:encoded: Mannnnn, this definitely wasn't my plan to blog tonight. I thought I was just gonna stop writing some poetry, take a shower, say my prayers and go to sleep; but apparently HE had other plans for me, and I must be obedient. So yeah... Now, you can't judge me, but apparently me and God be having the most best, intimate, and revealing conversations EVER when I am in the shower. Part of me relate it to be in the Garden before sin came along, you know, all naked and free, and another part of me look at it like while I'm washing the dirt off from my today, He's also cleansing me of my sins of the day, but whichever way, the conversation is there. So tonight, I'm taking my shower and He asks me, "So Danika, who or what am I to you?" I'm like **scoffs** "Seriously dude, You're like everything to me!" And He's like, "Nah my child, that's not what I'm asking you, I need you to dig deep." I ain't like that, but I did it. Flashbacks started coming to me.. I recalled quite a few times driving home drunk from a night out of partying or just drinking, but then again, it was always a party where there were drinks for me, anywho..off topic, and there were quite a few times I don't remember driving or knowing how I made it home, so I was like, "Ok Lord, you were my protector." He was like, "Good, that's a start." Then I remember this one time I snuck out the house, and before doing so I prayed and promised Him that if He would keep me from getting caught, that I would never do it again. I didn't get caught (and never did it again), and even though I was doing wrong, He was my watchman. I used be a liar, like for no reason, eventually it caught up with me and I lost my mom's trust (worst thing EVER by the way), but He got me out some stuff and pleaded my case, so He was my Lawyer. He's been my doctor, my healer, my comforter, my friend. So as I'm reflecting, saying, and realizing all this, I'm like, "Well, God, why are you asking me this?" **Mental note, don't ask Him questions and not be prepared for the answers** This guy slapped me ALL the way in the face, He said, "So since you know that I am and have been these things to you once before, why do you not trust me to be it all to and for you now?" Woooooow!!! Talk about a Spirit Check! You know, it's like a bittersweet thing to me when He's the one, personally checking you, and He's not using another entity to do so. It gives me that sense of a Father/Daughter relationship and comfort cuz it's like, "man, He's really taking time out to chat it up with me, I MUST be special to Him" and that makes the conviction and discipline easier to take. "My son [daughter], despise not the chastening of the Lord; Neither be weary of His correction: For whom the Lord loveth, He correcteth; Even as a father the son in whom he delighteth." Proverbs 3:11-12 (KJV). If He didn't care, He wouldn't chastise or correct, He would just let you continue on as you were without Him. But I thank God for His discipline. He's always right, whether you want to admit it or not. Funny as I'm typing this because just today in church we were talking bout being predestined and how He foreknew us before we were saved (Romans 8:29-30) and Pastor said something along the lines of always having a "Godly conscious" even when you were doing wrong and that is sooooo true! Clearly you can see that He's been with me even before I fully accepted Him as my Lord and Savior, making vows to Him knowing that I was outside of His will and yet, He STILL came through for me. Why!? Because He FOREKNEW that I would be sitting here tonight writing this blog. You can't tell me God is NOT good! He glorified, justified, called, predestined, and foreknew me to be available and acceptable for those situations to occur in my life, so He could come through for me and for me to reflect and realize the reality of it all and share it. God was right, before I knew Him, I trusted Him, and now that I know Him, I'm doubting Him. How backwards is that?! My whole purpose of writing this blog tonight is just to truly reflect on who He is and what He is to you and to say that He always is...and that's just it!. He is... "I AM THAT I AM" (Exodus 3:14) is He. What He was back then; He can and will be today, tomorrow, and forever. "Jesus Christ is the same yesterday, and today, and forever" Hebrews 13:8 (KJV). There is no changing for Jesus. He healed you before, He can do it again, He delivered you before, He can do it again, He comforted you before, He can do it again. Whatever you need, He can and shall provide (Philippians 4:19). Just trust Him. Truly let God be your everything and watch how your everything unfolds. -DanikaKayelle XOXO

item.title: Sweet escape..
item.dc:creator: Danika
item.content:encoded:
"No matter what you do or where you go, you can't escape yourself." --line from "Awkward." Man...How deep is that!? I had to rewind and replay that line over and over again.. It was just what I was feeling...even now. I just had the "luxury" of going on a cruise. Escaped from everything: life, family, friends, social media, work; it all and it was GREAT! It was great because I didn't have to deal with reality. Not having to deal with it was the best feeling in the world. Being trapped inside of this big boat that had everything, but a movie theater, in the middle of NO where was just what I needed dealing with everything that I'm dealing with. It could have been longer, but the truth is exactly what Mr. Hart said in that quote. All the ills of my life, no matter what I do or where I go, I can't escape it, it will always be there for as long as I don't deal with it. Could have been on the boat for months, wouldn't have changed a thing.
I love a great escape, why?! Because when I started to look back, that's all I knew, all I see. I'm surrounded by people who cover stuff up. Sweep it under the rug type thing. Crazy thing is that blowed me about them, like I never felt right about that, but the truth of the matter is, I am the same doggone way! I would blow stuff off, put it under the repressed barrier and go on bout my what I think is "merry" way. Is it healthy!? Heck nah!!! Why?! Cuz it creeps back up. So now what?? You have to live life, what do you do??? You deal with it!!
I had the honor of having my "rights" read to me one night. I didn't want it, nor did I ask for it, but God knew I needed it. I know what my problem is and I would acknowledge it, but I wouldn't do anything about it and that's where the problem comes in. I remember my Pastor saying something about being the best "you" you could be. I believe we were talking about being used and maximizing that. And that's been playing in my head because I sometimes find myself questioning who I am. I'm sure that's another blog for another day though.
So! Truth of the matter is... Reality is real. Whatever is going on in your life is really happening. It is your choice to see, acknowledge, accept, deal with it, and live through it. "Through" because eventually it will end. It makes absooooooolutely NO sense in letting your "situation" kill you right then and there. Yes, things are hard...this is true, but you are not alone. I don't know what you go through, you don't know what I go through, but the thing in common is that we all go through! There is no getting around it. What I try to do now is look for God in every situation. Try to figure out what it is that He is saying to me or wanting me to see. Realize that seasons MUST change. Remembering the goods outweigh the bads. God is with me always (Matthews 28:20), and again, I am not alone. It all starts with you. God has plans for us all, but He can't do anything with it without participation from us. We have to "man up" and face our problems, our situations; instead of running away, escaping, sweeping it under the rug, or pretending like it doesn't matter or bothering us. Its time to suit up. You're not happy with a situation, call it out...do something about it, and make a change!!
Be blessed, you got this!
-DanikaKayelle XOXO

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
I find it interesting how we find "joy" or maybe even a sense of freedom in isolation from our reality.. yet deep down inside we really don't want to "have to be" isolated..we don't want that "need" to be unreachable from those we normally interact with on a daily basis---be it loved ones of not---if that makes any sense. The quote from "Awkward" only placed a bigger weight on my shoulders--not only for its obvious truth...but also because I, too, am guilty of loving the getaways, the missings-in-action, the outta-sight/outta-mind mentality or simply being the....runaway. It's SO easy to "sweep it under the rug" as you say or respond to our situations with a *shrug*... *flips hair* ....or the infamous "I'm over it" declaration... but He STILL waits on us; He STILL reaches down to help us out when we begin to sink a little too deep into ourselves!! After reading this post and fighting whatever it is going on inside of me...all I can think about is God's faithfulness to our struggles--even when we look for the first "elation" to abandon them.... "In my distress I called upon the LORD, And cried to my God for help; He heard my voice out of His temple, And my cry for help before Him came into His ears." (Psalms 18:6 NASB)
Xo!

item.title: Control, Alt, Delete
item.dc:creator: Danika
item.content:encoded:
So we all know with the new year approaching, there's a bunch of "new" mindsets running around here. Now I'm all for revamping yourself and things, but that don't just happen with the change of the date. I mean, it can, but you have to take necessary steps. I will admit, I have separation anxiety, but I started taking steps for a change. I used to always wonder why people always said to move on from someone to "unfollow, block, delete, change your number", or whatever else to get rid of them and now I see! I've been talking changing my phone number for quite some time and I was like, "you know what, new year, new number, new me," and then it dawned on me, like, "nah...if you gon do it Danika, just do it, what's stopping you?!" So, I started taking steps and got it changed and when I tell you, I finally got what they were talking about!! Tis amazing!! It's like a whole new chapter. You now controls who can contact you, you determine who needs to know of this "change" and who doesn't and the best part of it all is that you don't owe any explanations! I mean, yeah, I probably could have kept my same number and still controlled that, but truth be told, it takes a LOT of energy to actively ignore people. Plus, I needed to be free from ALL ties whatsoever with certain people and this was the way. You can "block" them, but I tried that before and still was receiving messages. But anywho!!! With this fresh start, it helped me take even MORE steps. I started deleting next. Cleaning out the phone book. What's the point of me having your number and you don't have mine? That's not going to do anything but later serve as a temptation, and why put myself in that situation?! I met a lot of great and new people in 2013, but that does not mean they should roll over to 14 with me. They served their time, played their parts, I got whatever it was that I was to take from it and now its time to be done with it. I think a lot of us hold on to things because deep down we "hope" that it would resurface for the better, but let's be real; most likely it wont! Dude (or whoever) can hit you up months, even a year from now, and still be the same. So why get your hopes up for that!? And in reality, you still holding on to that is only hindering you from moving on. I remember last time I changed my number couple years back was to get rid of some dude, but ol silly me gave dude my new number anyways!! Don't do that! If you're changing it to be free from a particular person, be free, don't go back. Luckily, this go round I changed it for me. As much as I say that I'm over a particular person or situation, the fact that they could just "hit me up" whenever they pleased kinda excited me. Why!? Because they were good people and we had great times together, and maybe, just maybe the next time they "hit me up" they had this great epiphany and became the person I wanted them to be! HA!!!! Lies!!! That's the things that has to go. The mentality that you need to be freed from . Its a bondage, hindrance, mind control. Justifying is not the way. (Man, how many times I need to repeat that!) Now, I'm not saying that every time something don't go right to change your number, no! What I'm saying is that change is necessary and required and it sometimes cost for things like a new number, location, job, whatever to happen. It's not just something that happens automatically with the change of a year. You should be constantly changing throughout the year. Why!? Because your seasons changes. From January 1st to December 31st, you should not be the same person. You declared a "new you" with the coming of a new year, so why would you be okay with still being the same.?! This year, I want a new me, not like I'm a totally new person who forgot where she came from, but a more improved me. I want to enjoy my freedom in Christ and no longer be a slave in bondage to the world. To "control" (with God) who/what I welcome in my life, "alt" what needs to be altered, and "delete" who/what needs to be deleted and not think twice about it. Live for the day, forgive so that I can be forgiven, and not be led into temptation. You know, make better Spirit led decisions and not "Danika/emotions" led decisions. I don't know what 2014 has in store, but I'm getting suited up and ready for what He has in store!!!!

"Our Father, which art in Heaven. Hollowed be thy name, thy kingdom come. THY WILL BE DONE in earth, as it is in Heaven. Give us THIS day, our daily bread, and FORGIVE US our debts, as WE FORGIVE our debtors. And lead us NOT into temptation, but deliver us from evil: For thine is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory, for ever. Amen."  Matthew 6:9-13 (KJV) [Emphasis on purpose]

-DanikaKayelle XOXO

item.title: What's Love got to do with it???
item.dc:creator: Danika
item.content:encoded:
"Love is patient, love is kind, it is not envious. Love does not brag, it is not puffed up. It is not rude, it is not self-serving, it is not easily angered or resentful. It is not glad about injustice, but rejoices in truth. It bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things. Love never ends." 1 Corinthians 13:4-8 (NET)

Love. Never. Ends. This morning, I woke up with this verse playing over and over in my head. I know every time I tell the same story about being in love with this one guy and now that I dig deep into this Word, I realize that it wasn't love. Some serious like, but definitely not love. I believe it's been playing over and over for me because I've been holding on to the fact that "I loved him and it ended, so its gonna be hard for me to love again." LIES!!! I believe this was an eye opener for me to say, "you think you've experienced love, but you haven't. Love never ends." I just so happened was laying on the couch playing with my phone and something told me to go catch up on some blogs. I did so and came across one of Sarah Jakes' blogs called, "Survive Again". Yet, again, I thought about my "love". She said: "I took you with me everywhere I went. I needed the memory of you with me so that I wouldn’t forget what to avoid the next time. I wasn’t hanging on to you because it felt good I needed to be cautious. I couldn’t be burned. I wanted to avoid meeting anyone like you ever again. If I carried you in my heart I would never forget how I ended up here. I hated who you made me become. Weaker than I could ever imagine, more wounded than I knew possible." That's exactly what I've been feeling. I never wanted to feel how I felt with him with another person, so I kept him with me as a reminder and anytime I felt "him" in another dude, it was time to cut the cord. But I wasn't doing me any justice, I was only doing me harm. "Taking you with me" entails that I'm not letting go. You can't move on if you haven't moved past. Broken? Bitter?? Battered??? Yes, I was all of that! As much as I put a smile on my face, say I'm not, believed I moved on, and was ready for the next one; was merely just a mask that is now being revealed to me. I am learning to love me. To be patient and kind, not envious, not bragging, puffed up, rude, self-serving, easily angered or resentful to and with myself. Realizing the injustice I have been causing myself over the past years, I'm not happy about, but the truth that I am now seeing, I am rejoicing! Me loving me is the start of me loving someone else. Me understanding the truth about this emotion and feeling that so many others take for granted is molding me and shaping me into the "helper" I was created to be. The deeper I press into God, the more my self-worth is revealed to me. People may say, "your standards are too high", "you're never going to find a guy like that", "you got to settle for something", "you're looking for perfect and ain't nobody perfect", "you're gonna be single forever"; don't let those things linger into your head and fill it with doubt! In a matter of SECONDS, Jesus turned water into wine, with a simple question, a paralyzed man was able to walk again, with a slight touch of His hem, a woman was instantly healed. This verse doesn't say that love is perfect, so perfection is not the goal. Love is the goal. If Jesus have standards, so should you. He doesn't say, "you can follow me and still do as you please", no! If that was the case, the road would not be narrow, but wide as all outdoors! You owe it to yourself to believe He who has it all, who knows it all, who sees it all, and who is writing it all. "Why pray and worry?" Why pray about a mate and then worry if He's gonna send you one or not.?! Redirect your focus. Pastor said Sunday, "In order to press forward, you have to 're' something: RE-new, RE-dedicate, RE-commit, RE-evaluate". Let us all RE-act to the press and go where it is we need to go. Don't carry anyone with you that should not be with you. You have to take up YOUR cross and follow. RE-lease people from your heart so that you may have room for Him to RE-veal and RE-lease the desires of your hearts to you. I would hate to see you stay at the same place while others are moving from your own doing. (and this is for me too!) Jesus is asking, "Will thou be made whole???" And it is a simple, "yes", don't even say "no". You owe it to yourself to love because God loves you and if HE can love you despite ALL your wrong doings, who are you to not love yourself!? Have glory in that, make peace with that, and believe in that. My brother, my sister, you are worth SO MUCH and you have so much to offer and to give. Don't let NO body take that away from you. He is a RE-storer, He can RE-establish you. Your heart has been broken into a million pieces??? Gather all of the pieces you can, even if some are missing, bring it to Him, lay it at His feet and say, "God, this is all of me, I give this to you and I want to be made whole, what will you do with this?" And watch how He turns your mess into a masterpiece!! Be whole. -DanikaKayelle XOXO

item.title: Labor Pains....
item.dc:creator: Danika
item.content:encoded: First and foremost, Happy New Years all!!!! The past few days in the new year, I've been feeling some discomfort from myself and folks around me, so I just started praying. The other night, I just wasn't feeling it; so I kinda just pushed God to the side and went to sleep. Granted, the next day I did repent. Well, this morning I was given a revelation that I shared with some friends: "If things aren't going your way, you're feeling down in the dumps, or that you should be doing or receiving better, just remember: after emotional roller coasters, discomforts, stress, bed rest, and labor pains, something beautiful is birthed." Now, I've never had any kids, but I guess with the two births that just happened recently, labor and giving birth was fresh on my mind. It's very easy to get distracted by things of other people when its not happening to you. Let me piggy back for a second, before I got that revelation I told God that I wanted a microwave miracle and that's wrong. The microwave is used to make cold things warm. Sometimes its still cold and you have to reheat it more than once, you may lose flavor in whatever it is you're microwaving, and if you don't eat it fast enough, it may get right back cold. In other words, the microwave is a quick fix. Food taste much better when it's cooked and prepared timely and properly. With the right seasoning, heat, and time, you will have a great meal and enjoy it a little bit more because you've put EFFORT into it. It wasn't no one else's work, but yours and you take pride in that meal. So bam! Just like with giving birth; it takes time, patience, effort. Guy and girl meet, guy and girl hits it off, guy and girl fall in love, guy and girl gets married, husband knows wife, wife is pregnant, wife goes into labor, husband and wife now have a baby. Of course it doesn't happen this way majority of the time nowadays, but you get my drift. All of that is a process. Some people have microwave babies and "skip the fall in love/married part", and jump from "guy and girl meet" straight to "guy knowing girl, pregnant, labor, baby". Regardless, microwave or cooking; after man knows woman (sperm fertilizes egg), before the baby gets here, momma has to go through some labor pains and that's what I want to talk about today. Life can be just like a pregnancy, just like labor pains. You can receive an epidural (a break from it), but even those wear off sometimes and you continue to feel everything. In the midst of all of that, something amazing happens. Birth! New life. I hear that once you see your child for the first time, all of that pain, stress, and everything you've endured was all worth it.  I want us to try and look at life like that. We all may not go through actual labor, but long as you have lived and continue living, all of us have gone through, is going through, or will go through different trials and tribulations where while we are in it, we are uncomfortable, screaming, crying, asking for the pain to go away, yelling, "give me that epidural NOW", and when we are out of it, we will see that we've overcame and what/who we became in the end was all worth it. As soon as we see ourselves for the first time after all of that, we will smile and say, "it was all worth it. Look how precious, look how beautiful you are." I know I am not the first to say that its easy to keep your head up when everything around you is tugging at your hair, but each day is a new chance to say, "you know what!? It may hurt now, but in the end, something beautiful will become of this". Or, its a new day to cut your hair off! Just kidding. But really, hang in there. God is still growing and developing you. Eventually you will be born and see that the process you just went through was all worth it. Stay encouraged. Some people be in labor for a few hours, some almost over a day! Each person and each process is different, but they all can possess the same results. Pray for me as I pray for all others who may be having labor pains right now. Pray for strength to endure even when the epidural has worn off. Pray to see and focus on the outcome rather than the what's happening now. "'For I know the plans I have for you' declares the Lord, 'plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future'."  Jeremiah 29:11 (NIV) Pray with me to trust Him and believe He will deliver because He is not a man who can tell a lie; He is God. Seleh. DanikaKayelle XOXO

item.title: A Woman's Worth
item.dc:creator: Danika
item.content:encoded:
"Who can find a virtuous woman? for her price is far above rubies." (Proverbs 31:10 KJV)
It has been said that rubies are the most valuable gems in the world and that they are rare.
Valuable:: worth a lot of money, very useful or helpful, important and limited in amount, having desirable or esteemed characteristics or qualities, of great use or service.
Rare:: marked by wide separation of component particles, marked by unusual quality, merit, or appeal, distinctive, superlative or extreme of its kind, seldom occurring or found, uncommon.
Are you selling yourself short or are you maximizing what you are?! Are you blending in with the crowd or are you standing tall, virtuous, and proud.? The Bible asks us, "Who can find a virtuous woman?" Are you interested in being found or are you just hoping that someone comes along and notice you blending with the speckles in the ground?? Rubies are rare, expensive, useful, important, unusual, distinctive, uncommon. Are you lacking these qualities?? People take pride in their possessions, they lock up all of their treasures. They are aware of the value and in the hands of the wrong person, jewels are taken for granted. A ruby doesn't fret when a diamond is purchased. A ruby understands that it's created only for the one who's worthy. The one who will cherish and admire it for how beautiful it is. Who will honor it, respect it, and protect it from harsh environments. Do you see yourself virtuous??!? Do you know how much you're worth!!?! God says, "her price is FAR above rubies". He says you are FAR above the most rarest and valuable gem in the world. He is searching for you. Man is on a hunt to answer God and say, "yes, I've found one. Here is she. This is my virtuous woman whom I will love, honor, cherish, and respect. Never to give her second best. The search has ended and she is so valuable to me." A woman who recognizes, knows, and illustrates her worth is a woman that God is asking for.
There are so many common gems in the world that when one stumble upon a ruby they can't help but to pause. God has man on a hunt. You, woman, is what man is searching for. Virtuous. Having or showing high moral standards. Yes baby! You with the war wounds and scars are worthy. You've been sold to different pawn shops way under your value and I am here to tell you that the pawn shops are now closed. Sell yourself short no more. Have pride in yourself. Know that your price is far above! God calls you virtuous. So now tell me....... What. Is. Your. Worth???
-DanikaKayelle XOXO

item.title: To my long lost...
item.dc:creator: Danika
item.content:encoded:
To the one who's reading this. I miss you. I love you and I desire to have a relationship with you. It sucks that we are one of the same flesh and blood and yet, I just feel so alone. We are distant, when I want to be close. I don't know what to do or how to get through and/or close to you, so I pray. I pray, I pray, and I pray. Praying that the Lord speaks to you and calls you so that we may have one thing in common outside of the blood that we share, which should be enough, but its not. If there's anything I've done to steer you away, I am sorry and I forgive you for the tears I've shared, the pain you've caused, and the bitterness I've held in my heart towards you even if you're sorry or not. I want you to be free and have a prosperous and happy life. I want you to be and have all of the desires of your heart. I want you to have the family that you desire to have. A better one that was an example to you. You are better than your past, you are better than your father, and you can start a new trend and dream for your seeds. I know you didn't have the motivation that you may have hoped for, but just know you are worth it all. You are worth the compliments, the "I'm proud of you for what you have done and accomplished", you are worth that! Know that!! You can be and have all that you want if you would just get out of your own way. Change your thoughts, change you mind. Begin to see life for all that it is. Embrace your days with a positive attitude and make the best out of each of them. Love the ones that are around you because you never know when you will see the last of them. Don't give up. Keep fighting not for you but for the lil ones. You have a legacy to leave, a life to impact. Be a great example. Be the person you wish you had to look up to. I know its hard, things are not looking like its going your way, but I know God has big things in store. I believe He will bless those I love through me. My desire is for you to get to know Him for yourself. To have the blessings over you and your house. He can heal if you just trust Him. He can prosper you, if you would bless Him. He desires to have a relationship with you and WE are not giving up. The questions will still come, the invite will always be there, and the prayers wont stop. I know you're hurting inside just as I was and I want to be by your side even though you wasn't at mine. I pray that something shakes so mightily that you know it was nobody BUT God and that a miracle happens for you. If ever you feel that no one is there for you, be sure in knowing that I will always be. Right here along with God. I love you and I need you. There are some people who's depending on you. Its time to start living like its true.
Your sister.
P.S. For anyone who is feeling lonely or disconnected from a loved one, just know that you are not alone. I am here with you and together we can mend things. If you needed to hear those words, please know, you are loved. I love you and I want the best for you. You are worth more that what the naysayers say and you can accomplish whatever it is your big and beautiful heart desires. I am praying for and with you my brothers and sisters. Praying for families to be mended back together, relationships to blossom, generational curses to be broken, and for you to leave a happy, healthy, and prosperous life and example for the generation to come and show them that you can overcome tragedies that came before you. We all have a past, but how will you let shape your future? Don't let it keep you there, its time to break free and move up the ladder. God doesn't want us to be bondage, He wants us to be free. You can do it. Say to yourself, "I can do it" until you begin to believe it and start to do it!!! I love you and will be praying and remember, God is with you always.
-DanikaKayelle XOXO

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: THIS is absolutely BEAUTIFUL; totally brought tears to my eyes.

item.title: One year a Christian:: Le journey thus far...
item.dc:creator: Danika
item.content:encoded:
Although, I haven't reached my year just yet, tonight's revival made me decide to write. It spoke on the "Here and Now" and the fierce urgency of the now, so I am taking advantage of my now. So! I thought I had a layout on how I wanted to blog about this journey, but I'm just gonna go with the Ghost and see where He takes us.
First off, I want to dedicate a song to this journey and this song is the very first song I've heard when I gave my life to Christ (2/11/2013) that broke me ALL the way down:: "Dear God" by Smokie Norful. Please take a listen. What I've learned so far is that God is good. I know that's like a cliché phrase, but it is really real. He is more than enough (El Shaddai) and in the very beginning I used to say it, you know, but as time went on, I began to believe it and now I know it. As I look back over this past year, the way I've seen God come in, shake and stir things up, and deliver has been ever so amazing! In this one year alone, it has been better to me than my many, many years living in the world. When I hear the song "Can't give up now" and it says "nobody told me the road would be easy", all I can is say, "Hmph, Hallelujah..tell me about it!" They ain't never lying! But!! If it was easy, everyone would be travelling on it. I've learned that once you change/start living right, people start leaving and throw that at you. I will always hear, "you changed", "you a church girl now", or "boy, you shol not the Danika you used to be" and guess what!? I'm not! And I'm happy I'm not. I used to get upset when people would come at me like that, but now I'm grateful when I hear that because I know that He is working and it is reflecting in my life, because you should know by my fruits; what I am producing and how I am living.(Matt 7: 16-20) Some people would say that my life is boring because all I do is church, school, work, and home; but in all honesty, my life is quite fulfilling. I don't have all that unnecessary drama from being around drama driven people, I don't have the heartaches and headaches from dealing with the wrong type of guys, and I don't have that emptiness or void from giving myself away to people who didn't have my best interest at heart. I would get asked the question, "Is it really that serious?", and the answer is YES!! Yes it is!!! It was that serious when I was out in the world having to be drunk before I can go out anywhere and have a good time, it was that serious when I just had to have him whether he had a wife or girlfriend at home, it was that serious when I was putting together a plan in place to travel to another state and go strip; so answer me now, why it can't be that serious for me to live for God!? All the things God has forgiven me from, healed and delivered me from, I OWE Him to be "that serious" for Him! God is ever so patient with me. He is using His very own delicate hands to patch up my wounds and heal my scars. When I didn't love myself, He loved me. When I tried to kill myself, He didn't let it happen. When I drove home drunk because I knew "I got this", He took the wheel, for all the tears I've cried, He has been blessing me with more smiles. God is doing things that I never imagined was possible. I figured I would just get caught up with some guy, become a baby momma, and be content with that; but He is showing me that He kept me from that because I am MORE than that. I am a virtuous woman (Prov 31:10), I am a God-fearing woman, I am a wife, I am a mother, I am fearfully and wonderfully made (Ps 139:14), I was created in His image (Gen 1:27), and I was NOT a mistake!
I've learned that God is a comedian. He has a GREAT sense of humor. The very last time I said I'm not having sex until I was in a "serious and committed relationship" for the umpteen time, I guess He was like, "She keep saying this but not doing it; Ima show her" and shol nuff, here I am saving myself for marriage! Now what is a more serious and committed relationship than that!? Haha.. He is one funny guy! They don't say "be careful what you ask for" just because. There is a true meaning behind that. The Bible says ask and you shall receive (Matt 7:7-8). I've learned that God is keeper and even when temptation arises, because it will, He definitely has a way out for you (1 Cor 10:13). I've learned that He is a restorer and all the things I've lost, He has replaced (1 Peter 5:10). I've lost worldly friends and He's given me Godly friends, I've lost worldly desires and He's given me Godly desires, I've lost myself and He gave me a better me, I've gave my heart away and He took it back and placed it right where it needs to be. God is a GOOD God. He wants for all mankind to know and see Him for that. He is the Lord in the land of the living (Ps 116:9).
My day to day song is "Brighter Day" by Kirk Franklin. Every word in that song is my exact feeling. "When I close my eyes and think of you, and reminisce of all the things you do..I can't imagine my life without you, it's like paradise now I know that it's real. It's a mystery for someone to give their life just for me, what you did on Calvary makes me wanna love you more.. I never knew I could be so happy, and I never knew I'd be so secure, because of your love life has brand new meaning, it's gonna be a brighter day.. Never thought that I would smile again, never thought the dark clouds would end, never thought that I would have a friend that would keep me, never leave me alone. Jesus you're my everything, the only one that makes my heart sing, now I know what real love means, its everlasting, lasting. Nothing can compare to the joy you bring, and everlasting love affair. Jesus my life will never be the same, I found someone who truly cares!" I truly cannot imagine my life without Him and/or going back to way I used to live. Where would I be without Jesus?? No lie, I would probably be with a chick and have a boyfriend on the side (can't get rid of the real deal!), degrading myself by throwing it all out and posting it all over the WORLD WIDE WEB (which means "Worldwide" people, get that!) and not living to my best of my ability. I probably wouldn't be in grad school and trying to better myself, because I would just be settling for an average life because I didn't know better and that I can live an ABUNDANT life (John 10:10). I would still be dealing with the same drama and heartaches, trying to mend broken pieces of a unhealthy relationship together. But now that I have God, I know that I can do ALL things through Christ Jesus who strengthens me! (Philippians 4:13)
What I would say to people who wants to find out on there own of this God I speak of and why I am the way I am or do the things I do, I would simply just say, "Try Him". If you've tried everything else and have yet to find that fulfillment, would it really hurt for you to give Him a go!? I mean really, what more do you have to lose??? If you are already down and out, the option He has is to bring you up and out. That's what I finally did. The saved life is a safe life. He protects you, He provides for you, He cares for you, your safety, your wellbeing, your happiness. He gives you peace, hope, purpose, and joy; a reason to keep pressing on. There are folks who are depending on me to keep on this path I'm taking. There are seeds that has been planted by others that are waiting for me to water and there are seeds in me that are waiting to be planted in others. I can't go back even if the devil offered me everything in the world because I realized that worldly happiness and gain is only temporary, but Spiritual happiness and gain is everlasting.
There are quite a few people I would like to thank and acknowledge whom I've met along the way that has truly been a blessing to me, but that would be another blog within itself! You all should know who you are though and I love each and everyone of you for all that you have done and what you are still doing. Continue praying for me as I pray for you and that goes for other as well. I pray that you will open up your heart and let Him in. This work that took place in me can also happen to you. I didn't believe it once myself, but once I gave Him a try, I haven't looked back since. I pray that this has been a blessing to someone and gave them the "confirmation" they needed. In Jesus' name, Amen.
My ending song is "It's not over (when God is in it)" by Israel and New Breed. I plays this song on REPEAT and sing it at the top of my lungs!!!
-DanikaKayelle XOXO

item.title: S&M: I like it, like it, come on!!
item.dc:creator: Danika
item.content:encoded:
Let's talk about sex!!!! Pretty Ricky asks, "Can you make it juicy for me?", Trey Songz wants to be "In the middle", Ciara says, "My body is your party", and yet, God asks and says, "Why spill the water of your springs in the streets, having sex with just anyone? You should reserve it for yourselves. Never share it with strangers." Proverbs 5: 16&17 (NLT) The Bible clearly defines that sex is between man and woman and is to be saved for marriage. "It is God's will that you should be sanctified: that you should avoid sexual immorality; that each of you should learn to control your own body in a way that is holy and honorable, not in passionate lust like the pagans who do not know God; and that in this matter no one should wrong or take advantage of a brother or sister. The Lord will punish all those who commit such sins, as we told you and warned you before. For God did not call us to be impure, but to live a holy life." 1 Thessalonians 4:3-7 (NIV) So now, a lot of times I get asked, "What is the purpose of waiting" and I ask back, "What is the point of NOT waiting!?" Why is it so important to have sex before marriage?? "What if you wait and then it be whack!?" Well, if you stayed pure from the beginning like you were supposed to, how will you know if its whack or not?! Hmmm... But let's keep it real. This day and age, all we see, read, and hear is sex, sex, SEX!!! They make it sound like it ain't nothing and it is SOMETHING!!! Sex is wonderful, sex is magical, sex is when two people transfer part of themselves on to another. God doesn't want you to NOT have sex, He wants you to have it the right way! With a covenant, under His protection. Genesis 2:24 (KJV) says, "Therefore shall a man leave his father and his mother, and shall cleave unto his wife: and they shall be one flesh." Every time you have sex outside of marriage you are leaving yourself open for destruction. Not just in a biblical aspect, but in a worldly one as well. You having sex before marriage is not a guarantee that person will stay with you. Okay, so its good and you continue to do it, but he/she doesn't want to commit and then what? You turn into a bump buddy and you may even possibly feel played because you gave yourself up to this person and they don't want nothing more than that to deal with you. So eventually you get tired of that and move on to the next, now what!? You guessed it!!! Y'all have sex!! Same story, different person. Do you know that each time you have sex with a person, a part of you stays with them and them with you??! "Do you not know that he who unites himself with a prostitute is one with her in body? For it is said, 'The two will become one flesh'" 1 Corinthians 6:16 (NIV). SOULTIES!! Why is it that you still think about them from time to time, even without noticing it.?! Whether it was good, bad, or just aiight; they have left their mark and now you can't get rid of it. When Jesus was at the well, He told the Samaritan woman to go call her husband and when she told Him she had no husband, He said unto her, "You are right when you say you have no husband. The fact is, you have had FIVE husbands, and the man you now have is NOT your husband" John 4: 17-18 (NIV). Wow!! So see how that ties into sex and marriage?? If you are having sex, it should be with your husband or wife. So now, I have to ask,  how many "husbands/wives" have you have and is that your husband/wife that you have now?? You call yourself a "Christian" right, but are you really being Christlike?? #Bodycheck #Spiritcheck #Bedcheck I'm not married so I can't attest to sex IN marriage, but I can attest to sex outside of marriage. Since becoming a born again virgin, and yes, that can happen, I now see why He says what He say. Premarital sex causes so much damage whether you realize it or not! You really do lose a part of yourself each time you engage in it and if you engage too much, you can lose yourself completely. Eventually you are going to feel you are worthless, only good for some joog; and please, let me be the one to tell you that you are not. You are worth SO much more than just sex! Granted, you have those soul ties, but you can be free from them! Will it take time and work?? YEAH! But is it worth it??? ABSOLUTELY!!! As you abstain, strength is what you gain. Confidence, standards, dignity, worth! You begin to learn that those who pushed sex on you and/or allowed for it all to go down really didn't have your true interest at heart, but I can tell you someone who does. God does and guess what?? He has the perfect person here on earth who does as well! Now, I'm not saying that if you're having sex with the person you are with now is not your husband/wife, but if you desire to have a deeper relationship with God and believe that He is calling you to stop living in sin and you trust and believe that He is more than enough and can supply all that you need, then why don't you let Him be that and more for you!?! If you roll over and look at that person who is not your husband/wife and tell them this and that you want to be born again and they say, "that ain't for me", let me encourage you to FLEE!! For Paul says, "It is better to marry than to burn" 1 Corinthians 7:9. You may think I'm crazy for saying that because you've been with that person for years and you've invested so much in/with them, y'all have kids, same friends, all in each other's families, combined income, a house, a good lil life going for yall, I get all that; but now let me ask.. Why haven't you marry??? What's the hold up? You have all that going for you and yet you are still S-I-N-G-L-E! Oh darn, what have I done!? Look, I'm not here to judge you, just here to tell you the truth and spread the gospel. I want everyone to be pure and to know Him for themselves. He is "something" for someone! Whatever that something is you need, that is He! My prayer and desire is for your soul to be saved for it is written: "For of this you can be sure: No immoral, impure or greedy person--such a person is an idolater--has any inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and of God. Let NO one deceive you with empty words; for because of such things God's wrath comes on those who are disobedient. Therefore do not be partners with them" Ephesians 5:5-7 (NIV). I will end with this: "Submit yourselves therefore to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you. Draw nigh to God, and He will draw nigh to you. Cleanse your hands, ye sinners; and purify your hearts, ye double minded." James 4:7-8 (KJV)

Father God, I pray that the words you have blessed me to write in this blog touches the hearts of those whom you sent it forth to touch for we know once your word leaves from your mouth shall not return unto you void, but it shall accomplish that which you please and it shall prosper in the thing whereto you sent it. God, I pray that we vow to be celibate and submit to you, trusting and believing that what you say is true and that you keep us as long as we are submitting and seeking you. Lord, I pray for those who will take this step after being tied down for so long, I pray their strength in you dear Jesus. You've done it for me, so I know you can do it for them. Lord, I pray your forgiveness on us and I thank you for your salvation and deliverance.  In Jesus name I pray, Amen.

--DanikaKayelle XOXO

item.title: I got the hook up!!
item.dc:creator: Danika
item.content:encoded:
Aaayyyyeee!!!!! What you need?? I know somebody who got it, for the FREE!!! No gimmicks, no fakeness, all real, pure, in its virgin state. No hidden agendas, its all yours for the taking if you want it and will accept it. It's so good, nobody will believe you when you tell them about this hook up! So what is it that you need?? My friend is willing and ready to provide you with it.
A friend actually inspired this blog. One day when we were texting she mentioned something about having a "connect" and it got me to thinking. We all know that in all actuality, it is not what you know but WHO you know. Well let me just share with you a few "what and who" cases of my own...
What I know is this world wants you to die, but WHO I know is Jesus and He wants you to live and MORE abundantly at that! John 10:10
What I know is sex before marriage is a sin, but WHO I know is Jesus and He forgives and gives you a new life and makes you a new creature in Him. 2 Corinthians 5:17
What I know is "friends" will come and go, but WHO I know is Jesus who will stick closer than a brother. Proverbs 18:24
What I know is people wants you to give up and give in, but WHO I know is Jesus who tells us to pray without ceasing. 1 Thessalonians 5:17
What I know is everyone will try and give you "advice", but WHO I know is Jesus who says beware of wolves in sheep clothing. Matthew 7:15
What I know is people will break their backs in regards to certain celebrities/people, but WHO I know is Jesus and there shall be no other gods/images before Him. Exodus 20:3
What I know is drinking is not a sin (being drunk is), but WHO I know is Jesus who says not to be drunk with wine but be filled with the Spirit. Ephesians 5:18
What I know is people will claim "Christian" and yet still live life their own way, but WHO I know is Jesus who says you will know them by their fruits and when they come to Him saying they have spoke in His name, He will say, "I never knew you." Matthew 7:20-23
What I know is people will talk to and about you, but WHO I know is Jesus and He said they hated Him first. John 15:18
What I know is people will hurt you and you can't really rely on "man", but WHO I know is Jesus who says He will never leave or forsake you. Joshua 1:5
What I know is there are many ups and downs in life, but WHO I know is Jesus and He tells us there is a time and a season for everything. Ecclesiastes 3:1
What I know is people really and truly think they are allazat and a bag a chips and nothing or no one can say or stop them, but WHO I know is Jesus who says man should not think more highly that he ought to think. Romans 12:3
What I know is people will try to tear you down and make you feel not special, but WHO I know is Jesus who will run after that one (you) even if He still have 99 sheep left and rejoice when He finds you. Luke 15:4-5
What I know is people will try to get you "sin" without having paid the price to tell you what you can and cannot do, but WHO I know is Jesus who knew no sin and yet, took upon sin so that we might be saved. 2 Corinthians 5:21
What I know is people will use/say/quote the Bible when it is convenient for them and not pay attention to the other books, chapters, and verses in it, but WHO I know is Jesus who says not to be led away with the error or their wickedness. 2 Peter 3:16-17
What I know is some people are really hard to love, but WHO I know is Jesus who says love everyone as He loved you. John 13:34
What I know, to prove a point, people will swear up and down on "their momma and nem grave", but WHO I know is Jesus who says not to swear by heaven or by earth, but to let your "yes" be your "yes" and your "nos" be your "nos". James 5:12
What I know is that we women tend to sell ourselves short, but WHO I know is Jesus who says "her price is FAR above rubies." Proverbs 31:10
What I know is that these are only a few scenarios/situations, but my hookup, my connect, my bootleg man, who just so happens to be the REAL deal can handle ANY situation you throw at Him. What I know is that it may seem rough right now, things aren't looking too good, stuff just not going right, you're tired, stagnant, overworked, overwhelmed, stressed, broken, hurt, burned, scarred, wounded, bitter, depressed, insecure, feels like things are only getting worse by the second, saying to yourself, "this just have to be it"; let me just share with you WHO I know. His name is Jesus, Emmanuel, El Shaddai, Jehovah Jireh, Jehovah Shalom, Jehovah Rapha. He wants you to cast your burden on Him (Psalm 55:22). He has all the supplies you need to live life. He is the way, the truth and the light (John 14:6). I can't stress enough how great God is and all that He can do, God is limitless (Psalm 147:5). There is no problem too big or too small for Him. Our thoughts are not His thoughts, His ways and His thoughts are higher than ours (Isaiah 55:9). I remember having the hookup with the pizza man who used to come through the 'hood with pizza and a 2-liter, but you had to catch him at a certain time or wait longer than the regular time of ordering one because he had the "deal", well, this hookup I'm talking bout is an INSTANT deal. You call Him and He will answer. Now granted, it may not be what you may want to hear, but God is Omniscient, He knows all (Psalm 139). This hookup will have you set for life.
What I know is that this world is going to end, but WHO I know will be coming back to give everyman according to his works (Revelation 22:12) and you don't want to be left behind. We wont know the day or the time, but we should and need to be ready (Mark 13:32). Will you be ready??!? Do you want the hookup!?
-DanikaKayelle XOXO

Awesome!!!! Praise God!!!!! Thanks! Super, totally appreciate it!!!

item.title: Casting call!!!
item.dc:creator: Danika
item.content:encoded:
So the other day I was saying to myself, "Man! If people were so committed to God and Jesus like they are with these reality and TV shows, the world would be a much better place!" I'm not knocking the people who write, produce, or star in these shows, but I am wondering why do most of all of them have the same kind of concept, and the only thing I can come up with is because that is what the people want to watch and see. I can speak on this because I once was caught up in it hype of a TV show: Scandal. I used to love me some Scandal. Had to be home EVERY Thursday, showered, and in the bed with a snack by 8:58 tuned in to ABC. Posting status after status, heart racing, and couldn't hardly even breathe for at least 12 minutes after the show was over. I was all #TeamOliviaandFitz and was rooting every time he disrespected Millie. I thoroughly enjoyed every sex scene Olivia and Fitz had and was like "Man, that's some real love and passion there!", but it wasn't! In all actuality, Fitz was an adulterer. Olivia was a side chick and blantly, just a piece of a$$. She had no value and no worth in herself, and yet, us girls wanted to be like her. Olivia had the power, Olivia had the upper hand, Millie may have had Fitz's last name, but Olivia had his heart; but who did Fitz say vows with, have kids with (which can be up in the air now cuz we are not sure if ANY of the kids are his), who takes all the pictures with him, be on the news with him, in his corner?? After he's done getting all in Olivia to where does he return to??? Home. And who's there?! Millie. And where is Olivia?? Her place. With who!!?!??! No one!!!! Aaaaah...in yet, she has the power and the upper hand. Dang! That angers me because I once felt this way about myself. "No matter what, its gon always be me and you, you could be married and all and it still wouldn't change a thing" is what I used to say. How freaking dumb is that!? But thank God for Jesus and deliverance!! Stupidity and settling no more! Amen!!
Now the new show that's out is "Being Mary Jane". I can't speak too much on it because I haven't watched it at all and I don't believe in speaking on things that I don't know about. I hear so much about the show though and all the things that I hear is purely disrespectful!!! I heard that the wife of the man that she's (MJ) sleeping with and supposedly is in love with comes and asks her questions about their sex life and she goes into details about it and things and apparently she is opened and okay with the wife knowing that she's banging her husband! Whaaaaaa...... As if black chicks don't have it bad enough, here we go starring black women in leading roles as "side chicks". Like why!? What ever happened to the "mom"? Whether she was a stay at home mom, working mom, or single mom. What ever happened to family? An honest and faithful family man? Do they no longer exist?? Or its just not worthy enough for us to watch and enjoy on television?? Women, women, ladies, girls...we have got to do better!!!! We can't fully fault a man for what they do because WE are the ones who allow them to do so!!! People are going to do what they know they can do and get away with. If he cheats on you and you know about it and stay with him with no consequences or repercussions, he is going to do it again! If you are married, yes that is grounds for divorce, but God can heal and mend a broken marriage. People do make mistakes, although "mistakenly" serving it up with another person normally have signs before it happens, it should never happen more that once. It shouldn't happen at all, but definitely not a two or more type thing. Idk bout that "oh it just happened 5 or 6 times working it out", but that's just my opinion. I'm not married, never have been put in that situation and I pray that I never WILL be placed in that situation, so this is a "speaking on it now, can't speak on it then" situation because I may have a different view or outlook on it if the shoes were on my feet. And if you are not married and you were looking for signs then uh....hellloooooo...that is it!!!! The Bible clearly states marriage is between one man and one woman. Let man be to his one wife and woman to her one husband. **Funny side note, one day I was thinking about like a threesome after you were married and then Sunday that same week, Pastor out of NOWHERE said that same saying about a man to his one wife and woman to her one husband, so he don't know when, where, and how a threesome came about... Talk about CONVICTION!!!! Hello!! He works and He knows. He knows your inner man, your thoughts that you don't share with nobody and He comes, delivering you the answer, whether you asked for it or not! Haha.. Anywho!!**
My thing is this. Watch who you "model"/look up to. Olivia may be good at her job, but she is no role model. Don't know how Mary Jane is at her job, but she is no good role model either. Majority, if not all of the chicks on ANY RHOwhatever show, which I still haven't figured out WHY its called "Real Housewives" or "Basketball Wives" and NONE of them are wives, but whatever, they are not good role models. You don't wanna be somebody side piece, you wanna be the full 3-6 course meal! Why settle for a piece of man when you can have a whole man! Don't you want someone who is always there for you? To comfort and to guide you?? Spend holidays, weekends, weeknights, and mornings with?? Go to sleep every night and wake up with? Olivia doesn't have that. I don't believe MJ has that either and yet we all #Teamgogetyourmarriedmanfromthatwomanhemarried. See, that looks and sounds dumb!!
But get this!! There is a movie coming up and here is the casting call:: Wanted!! Women and men seeking after God's own heart. Virtuous, loyal, proud, giving, loving, caring, kind, prosperous, humble, meek, wise, understanding, serving, worthy, faithful, and knowing of their worth. Do you want the job or you're gonna continue being an extra??? Stop settling, its time to claim your spot! Wait, let me clarify that before these "number twos/side pieces" be tryna tell that married man/woman to leave their wife/husband and be with them. People, listen....if the man/woman have somebody he/she is not your body...GET THAT!! Ladies:: There is a man looking for you, but if you're caught up running behind someone else's he is never going to catch up with you!!!! Stay your lil tail still and be patient!! You're probably prolonging the search. And men!!! Being a "player" is not what's up. Banging all these different chicks, having all these babies, and bragging about it AND not taking care of them is not what's up. Where are YOUR standards!? You're selling yourself short too. Get that! You cry about you wanting "loyalty" and "one chick that's down for me" and yet, you running around dipping and dodging into any and everything!!! Such an oxymoron. Get your stuff together. Quick to claim there are no good women out here and you're the most rotten fruit on the tree! You attract what you are. You're a club hopper, you're going to meet a club hopper. You're a street n*gga, you're going to meet a street chick and vice versa. It's plain and simple. You can't be the devil and expect an angel. Darkness and light doesn't play well together my dear. I pray every night that we can get it together. So howsabout it, are you up for the call???
--DanikaKayelle XOXO

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Good advice kayelle

item.title: Letting go...
item.dc:creator: Danika
item.content:encoded:
"Letting go" is not a noun. It is more than a phrase. Letting go is an action. It requires work and actually doing what it states:: Letting go! In order to let go of something, a person must release it out of their possession and possibly into the possession of another. When a person gets "let go" from their job, they have been fired, released, never to return again.... When you let go, it frees you up to catch, capture, and possess something else for yourself. The more you try to hold on to things, the more difficult it will become to take on new things. Eventually, you are going to have to let go of something. Depending on what you're doing, you make take letting go as a form of giving up, but its really not. It's a form of moving on. Realizing that you have done all you can do, you put your best effort into it and it just wasn't enough and you realized that your time was done. Take tug-a-war for instance. Two teams on both sides of a rope pulling each other, trying to become champs. Your pulling and pulling, with all your strength and all your might, the tug is on going. You get the upper hand, they tug a little harder, and you get pulled back. Eventually there will become some wear and tear. Eventually one team would have given it their all and finally will release the rope. What happens then!? Yes, the other team have the victory, but after the "released team" stumbles back, they will get up feeling great because they have let go of what was causing them grief, hurt, pain, and discomfort. As seen in the demonstration above regarding tug-a-war, when you release something that you had such a tight grip on, you will stumble back, but do not let that deter you! Just because you stumble, does not mean you've fallen and/or down! Letting go is not only for you, but it is for whatever is being let go. It frees you and it from each other, allowing both entities to be released and opened and available for what may come next. Letting go is freedom, its life, its accepting that you are really not in control and being okay with that. It's refreshing and it allows you to go on with your day and your life with no regrets and no look backs. It's throwing in the towel and saying, "I surrender! I have given it my all and my all was not enough, so I'm letting go and releasing myself to be ready and get prepared for what may happen and come next." I promise, ever since I really tried to stop figuring things out myself, holding on to things, quit focusing on the "what if's", and trying to analyze and think of what I could have done differently, I have truly been able to enjoy life!! Seeing it for the beauty that it truly is. Having breath in my body, blood flowing in my veins, and appreciating the simple things. And all of that is because I have let go! I have surrendered, said, "you know what, I am tired of carrying all of these things, I'm tired, its heavy, my mind is cloudy, I feel like I'm not living and life is just passing my by." I let go and let God. He cannot do what He wants to do without our participation. You may ask, "why not because God is God and He can do anything?", this is true, however, God uses man for His manifestation (learned that in Bible Study last week!). You see, God can't use and utilize me like He wants to if I'm still holding on to bitterness, anger, insecurities, pain, brokenness, people, and unforgiveness. He wouldn't be able to speak through me and into the lives of others if I didn't rid myself of those things and then some. God is love. A broken, bitter, angry, insecure, full of pain and hatred person cannot and will not be able to show love, let alone give love; therefore, God would not have been seen or known because He is love. Letting go is a necessity. It is what will promote you to another level. It will allow you to empty out some things so that you may be filled with new things. A person or a situation that you are holding on to, may very well have moved on and you are still stuck. Why!? Because you are still holding on. If you let it go, you free not only the situation or person from you, but YOU free YOURSELF from that situation or person and now you are open to allow other opportunities to come to you. So you do have some control. You can control whether you stay or whether you go. You shouldn't have no man or situation to control or have power over you! God is the one who should be in control. He can go and take you where man cannot. It will be hard and may even be a bit difficult, but it will all be worth it! Take it from me. Soon you will be free and feel that weight being lifted off of you. I still have work to do and ways to go. I just ask that you pray FOR me as I pray for and with you. We shall overcome....together, with the help of God on our sides.

"I can do ALL things through Christ who strengthens me." Philippians 4:13 (NKJV)

"Come to me, all you who are weary and burdened, and I will give you rest." Matthew 11:28 (NIV)

"When doubts filled my mind, your comfort gave me renewed hope and cheer." Psalm 94:19 (NLT)

"Casting all your care upon Him; for He careth for you." 1 Peter 5:7 (KJV)

"Throw your burden upon the Lord, and He will sustain you. He will never allow the Godly to be upended." Psalm 55:22 (NET)

Selah.

-DanikaKayelle XOXO

item.title: Yo no se.
item.dc:creator: Danika
item.content:encoded:
Hmmm...been a while, so where do I begin!? This past week alone has been a testful one. I believe I passed, but not with flying colors. You see, I still have faults. I am far from perfect; but I know, that each day I wake up is another day to strive for it. Look, I'll keep it real with you. Its hard, things are not going the way I expected it, I'm alone and isolated, and I'm still missing my grandpa like crazy!!! The upside in all of that is, even though I am physically feeling these hits, I am spiritually satisfied. I am happy, and joyous, and learning to understand the woes of life. This is why I truly believe I have not fallen yet or broken. God is keeping me. He's is building me and making me stronger because of something is bigger than me! I don't exactly know what that "something" is, but it is going to be a big deal!! Mark my word for it. The little stuff that I look back and reflect on, seeing where He is literally taking and molding me, keeps me grounded. It keeps me motivated and wanting to move forward. My life is a testimony to someone, my words will touch somebody, my actions are a visual for people who are looking and asking God if it can be done!! I no longer do things for me, but He. Trust me!! I got two tickets in two days. Stupid, pointless tickets, I wanted to let that State Trooper have it sooooooo bad, but all I could do was smile, nod my head, laugh, thank him for doing his job, and tell him to have a great day. I was so heated as I drove off I almost started to cry because I couldn't "let him have it" and it was boiling in the inside, but then I had to sit back and analyze the situation. It could have been worse. I have illegal tint on my car, he even mentioned it. I KNOW if I woulda went in on him, he most definitely would have got me for that and that" improper seat belt" ticket (no ticket as he put it, blah!) would have been possibly quadruple the price. Then the next day, I walk out of class, I have a stupid parking ticket, what the world!? Now that day, I ain't gon lie, in my head, somebody got cussed out! Didn't change anything though. So all in all, my little rant didn't change anything. Oh, but when He says your latter will be greater (Haggai 2:9)!!!
The devil gets a text message when God is about to bless you (Pastor said that one day). Satan does not want to see you succeed. He wants you to fail tremendously! God is doing great things this year for His children. This is the year of great things. The devil is coming in full affect, throwing every thing at you, and you will have to decide to stand and fight through! Remember you are not alone. There are Christians all over the world fighting their own battles and temptations right along with you (1 Peter 5:8-9). Look, God doesn't want His people to suffer and it would be really great if you could live for Christ and not undergo anything, but WE were the ones who messed up in the first place, because we didn't believe that God was enough and we didn't take Him at His word. How many of us still do this???? Guilty at times, but hey, that's human nature. Not to mention, Jesus SUFFERED for us, so who are we to say, "God don't let me go through anything." I ain't never put my life of the line for anyone, died, and rose again. I'm just saying. We as a people, we as a church, we as members of God's body HAVE to get better at trusting and believing that God is enough! We have to get the point to where if God blesses us no more, we would still say, "Thank you anyways." God blesses us more than we deserve and if any person says otherwise, they are in true denial. God loved us when we loved Satan. He had His hand on us when we didn't have Him on our last mind. Yes, God washes all that away, but you could and should never forget where you came from, in my opinion.
Each of us have a story to tell. Each of us has a past. That does not disqualify for God's forgiveness, grace, mercy, peace, joy, longsuffering, and love; it qualifies you for it!!!! That is a requirement. He loves the broken, He can heal and mend all of your broken pieces. When all you see is darkness, He is the only way out. He is the light! You don't even have to wait until you hit the floor, you can call on Him while you're falling and allow Him to catch you and/or lessen your pain. Look, I'm not saying it is easy, I'm not saying things will turn around and get better immediately, but what I am telling you is it will be all worth it!!!! From Depressedville to Joyland. The transformation is amazing despite the rough and sometimes bumpy transportation.
-DanikaKayelle XOXO

item.title: Now!
item.dc:creator: Danika
item.content:encoded:
This morning when I woke up, "time, time, time" was on my mind. I got to thinking how we humans tend to normally think, "When its the right time" or "Its not the right time" and I'm like, "When it is time, that's when it is the right time." We try to make our own time when God already have everything planned and mapped out for us. Yes, there is a designated time for everything, but we prolong it and/or prevent it from happening.
I hear a lot of people talk about how they gotta get some things in order before they come before God, go to church, or become saved, when in reality, that is most likely never going to happen because those very "things" just may be what He is calling you for so He can assist you and "getting them together." NO one can fill a void and make you whole BUT God. No man, no woman, no job, no relationship, no marriage, no career, no money, no hug, no kiss, no intercourse, no kids, no nothing! I used to think if I had a child, then everything would be alright; that I would have somebody who was "destined" to love me and I would feel complete. Do you know how wrong I was?! I don't have any children, but I have God and this is the most completed and whole I have ever felt in my whole life!!!!!
